dh

dha 1

letter. (gram) letter dh; 27th letter of the alphabet; dental consonant ✓

Grammar letter, masc
Meaning (gram) letter dh; 27th letter of the alphabet; dental consonant
Sanskrit dha

Examples

18. do dhassa ca.

bālāvatāra sarasandhi

sare pare dhassa kvaci do hoti.

bālāvatāra sarasandhi
dha 2

abbrev. abbreviation of Dhamma (pada) ✓

Grammar abbrev
Meaning abbreviation of Dhamma (pada)
Sanskrit dharma

Example

{dha. pa. 423; itivu. 99} pubbenivāsaṃ yo vedī,
sagg'āpāyañ'ca passati.
atho jātikkhayaṃ patto,
abhiññāvosito muni.

AN 3.59 tikaṇṇasuttaṃ
dhakkhiṇaggi

masc. fire that is one worthy of gifts ✗
dhakkhiṇā

fem. gift, donation; fee; benefit or merit of a gift ✗
dhakkhiṇena

ind. on the south or right side; to the south ✗
dhaṅka

masc. crow ✗
dhaṅkarūpa

adj. with the appearance of a crow ✗
dhaja 1

masc. flag; banner; lit. flapping [√dhaj + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning flag; banner; lit. flapping
Root Family √dhaj
Root √dhaj×1 a (move, flap)
√ In Comps ddhaj
Construction √dhaj + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym ketu
Commentary (SNa) dhajo rathassā'ti mahantasmiṃ hi saṅgāmasīse dūrato'va dhajaṃ disvā, asukarañño nāma ayaṃ ratho'ti ratho pākaṭo hoti.
Sanskrit dhvaja
Sanskrit Root √dhvaj 1 (go)

Examples

bhāsaye jotaye dhammaṃ,
paggaṇhe isinaṃ dhajaṃ,
subhāsitadhajā isayo,
dhammo hi isinaṃ dhajo'ti.

AN 4.48 visākhasuttaṃ

dhajo rathassa paññāṇaṃ,
dhūmo paññāṇam'aggino,
rājā raṭṭhassa paññāṇaṃ,
bhattā paññāṇam'itthiyā'ti.

SN 1.72 rathasuttaṃ
dhaja 2

masc. emblem, symbol [√dhaj] ✗
dhaja 3

masc. pride; arrogance; lit. flag [√dhaj + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning pride; arrogance; lit. flag
Root Family √dhaj
Root √dhaj×1 a (move, flap)
√ In Comps ddhaj
Construction √dhaj + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym atimāna, dappa
Sanskrit dhvaja
Sanskrit Root √dhvaj 1 (go)

Example

atha vā dantavidaṃsakaṃ hasamāno. so hassatī unnamatī ca tenā'ti so tena jayatthena unnato hoti unnamo dhajo sampaggāho ketukamyatā cittassā'ti, so hassatī unnamatī ca tena.

NIDD1 8 pasūrasuttaniddeso
dhajagga

nt. top of a standard ✗
dhajaggasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 11.3 (SN11.3) ✗
dhajabandha

adj. marked; notorious (?) ✗
dhajālu

adj. adorned with flags [√dhaj] ✗
dhajāhaṭa

adj. captured in war; taken in a raid; lit. flag brought [dhaja + āhaṭa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning captured in war; taken in a raid; lit. flag brought
Construction dhaja + āhaṭa
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhajena + āhaṭa)
Commentary (VINa) dhajena āhaṭā dhaj'āhaṭā, ussitaddhajāya senāya gantvā paravisayaṃ vilumpitvā ānītā'ti vuttaṃ hoti, taṃ koci bhariyaṃ karoti, ayaṃ dhaj'āhaṭā nāma.
Sanskrit dhvajāhṛta
dhajinī

fem. army ✗
dhajī

adj. bearing standards, army ✗
dhañña 1

adj. lucky; auspicious; fortunate; lit. rich [√dhan + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from dhana
Meaning lucky; auspicious; fortunate; lit. rich
Root Family √dhan
Root √dhan×1 a (be rich)
Construction √dhan + ya
Derivative kita (ya)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Synonym bhadra, sirīmant, subhaga
Sanskrit dhānya
Sanskrit Root √dhan 3 (bear fruit)

Example

nadato parisāyaṃ te,
vādīdappāpahārino,
ye te dakkhanti vadanaṃ,
dhaññā te narapuṅgava.

API 17 mahāpajāpatigotamītherīapadānaṃ
dhañña 2

nt. grain; crops [√dhan + ya] ✓

Grammar nt, from dhana
Meaning grain; crops
Root Family √dhan
Root √dhan×1 a (be rich)
Construction √dhan + ya
Derivative kita (ya)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Sanskrit dhanya
Sanskrit Root √dhan 3 (bear fruit)

Examples

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yaṃ bhattā āharati dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā taṃ ārakkhena guttiyā sampādeti, tattha ca hoti adhuttī athenī asoṇḍī avināsikā.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave ubhatomukhā putoḷi pūrā nānāvihitassa dhaññassa seyyath'idaṃ sālīnaṃ vīhīnaṃ muggānaṃ māsānaṃ tilānaṃ taṇḍulānaṃ

DN 22.5 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
dhaññakaraṇa

nt. threshing-floor, granary; lit. making grain [dhañña + karaṇa] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning threshing-floor, granary; lit. making grain
Construction dhañña + karaṇa
Commentary (VINa) dhaññakaraṇan'ti khalaṃ vuccati.
dhaññakarana

nt. threshing floor ✗
dhaññagaṇa

nt. mass of grain; horde of crops [dhañña + gaṇa] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning mass of grain; horde of crops
Construction dhañña + gaṇa
dhaññaphala

nt. harvest ✗
dhaññamāsa 1

masc. rice grain ✗
dhaññamāsa 2

masc. measure of length (7 ūkā = 1 dhaññamāsa; 7 dhaññamāsa = 1 aṅgula) ✗
dhaññamupeti

pr. acquires grain [dhaññaṃ + upeti] ~

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning acquires grain
Construction dhaññaṃ + upeti
dhaññarāsi

masc. heap of grain; pile of corn [dhañña + rāsi] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning heap of grain; pile of corn
Construction dhañña + rāsi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhaññānaṃ + rāsi)
Sanskrit dhanya + rāśi

Example

āgantukassa bhattaṃ āgantukabhattaṃ, methunā apeto methun'āpeto, corā bhayaṃ corabhayaṃ, rañño putto rājaputto, dhaññānaṃ rāsi dhaññarāsi, rūpe saññā rūpasaññā, saṃsāre dukkhaṃ saṃsāradukkhaṃ.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 327
dhaññavant

adj. fortunate, lucky [√dhan] ✗
dhaññasama

adj. like grain; equal to grain [dhañña + sama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like grain; equal to grain
Construction dhañña + sama
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhaññena + sama)
Commentary (SNa) dhaññena ca samaṃ dhanaṃ nāma n'atthi. (yadā hi sattā dubbhikkhā honti), tathārūpe hi kāle hiraññasuvaṇṇ'ādīni gomahiṃs'ādīni'pi dhaññaggahaṇatthaṃ dhaññasāmikānam'eva santikaṃ gahetvā gacchanti.
Sanskrit dhanya + sama

Example

n'atthi attasamaṃ pemaṃ,
n'atthi dhaññasamaṃ dhanaṃ,
n'atthi paññāsamā ābhā,
vuṭṭhi ve paramā sarā'ti.

SN 1.13 natthiputtasamasuttaṃ
dhaññasamavāpaka

nt. grain and seeds ✗
dhaññāgāra

nt. granary ✗
dhata

pp. remembered; retained in mind; known off by heart [√dhar + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of dharati
Meaning remembered; retained in mind; known off by heart
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > t
Synonym dhārita
Variant dhāta
Commentary (ANa) dhātā'ti dhātā paguṇā. ekaccassa hi uggahitabuddhavacanaṃ dhātaṃ paguṇaṃ niccalikaṃ na hoti, asukaṃ suttaṃ vā jātakaṃ vā kathehī'ti vutte, sajjhāyitvā saṃsanditvā samanuggāhitvā jānissāmī'ti vadati. ekaccassa dhātaṃ paguṇaṃ bhav'aṅgasotasadisaṃ hoti, asukaṃ suttaṃ vā jātakaṃ vā kathehī'ti vutte uddharitvā tam'eva katheti. taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ dhātā'ti.
Sanskrit dhṛta
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo khippanisantī ca hoti kusalesu dhammesu, sutānañ'ca dhammānaṃ dhārakajātiko hoti, dhatānañ'ca dhammānaṃ atth'ūpaparikkhī hoti attham'aññāya dhammam'aññāya, dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipanno hoti.

AN 4.97 khippanisantisuttaṃ

ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthā sabyañjanā, kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ abhivadanti, tathārūpāssa dhammā bahussutā honti, dhatā, vacasā paricitā, manas'ānupekkhitā, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.

dhataraṭṭha 1

masc. name of one of the four great kings ✗
dhataraṭṭha 2

masc. name of two of the seven Bharata kings ✗
dhana 1

nt. wealth; riches; treasure [√dhan + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning wealth; riches; treasure
Root Family √dhan
Root √dhan×1 a (be rich)
Construction √dhan + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym adhana
Synonym bhoga
Sanskrit dhana
Sanskrit Root √dhan 3 (bear fruit)

Examples

pamādam'anuyuñjanti,
bālā dummedhino janā,
appamādañ'ca medhāvī,
dhanaṃ seṭṭhaṃ'va rakkhati.

DHP 26 appamādavaggo

ārogyaparamā lābhā,
santuṭṭhiparamaṃ dhanaṃ,
vissāsaparamā ñāti,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ.

DHP 204 sukhavaggo
dhana 2

nt. value; cost; price; money [√dhan + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning value; cost; price; money
Root Family √dhan
Root √dhan×1 a (be rich)
Construction √dhan + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym adhana
Sanskrit dhana
Sanskrit Root √dhan 3 (bear fruit)

Example

añña'd'atthu pañjaliko'va naṃ yācati, dehi me, mārisa, urabbhaṃ vā urabbhadhanaṃ vā'ti.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
dhana 3

nt. virtue; value; quality; lit. wealth [√dhan + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning virtue; value; quality; lit. wealth
Root Family √dhan
Root √dhan×1 a (be rich)
Construction √dhan + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym adhana
Synonym kalyāṇa
Sanskrit dhana
Sanskrit Root √dhan 3 (bear fruit)

Example

saddhādhanaṃ sīladhanaṃ,
hirī ottappiyaṃ dhanaṃ,
sutadhanañ'ca cāgo ca,
paññā ve sattamaṃ dhanaṃ.

AN 7.6 vitthatadhanasuttaṃ
dhanakaraṇīya

nt. business matter; lit. ought to be done with wealth [dhana + karaṇīya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning business matter; lit. ought to be done with wealth
Construction dhana + karaṇīya
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhanena + karaṇīya)
Sanskrit dhana + karaṇīya

Example

so kismiñci'd'eva dhanakaraṇīye samuppanne na sakkuṇeyya upanīhātuṃ dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā.

AN 10.24 mahācundasuttaṃ
dhanakkīta

adj. purchased with money; bought with cash [dhana + kīta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning purchased with money; bought with cash
Construction dhana + kīta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhanena + kīta)
Commentary (VINa) appena vā bahunā vā dhanena kītā dhanakkītā. yasmā pana sā na kītamattā eva saṃvās'atthāya pana kītattā bhariyā, tasm'āssa niddese dhanena kiṇitvā vāsetī'ti vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit dhana + krīta
dhanakkītācakka

nt. bought with money cycle [dhanakkītā + cakka] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bought with money cycle
Construction dhanakkītā + cakka
dhanakkhaya

masc. exhaustion of wealth ✗
dhanajāni

fem. loss of wealth [dhana + jāni] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning loss of wealth
Construction dhana + jāni
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhanassa + jāni)
Sanskrit dhana + hāni

Example

tato kāyena vācāya,
vadhaṃ katvāna kodhano,
kodh'ābhibhūto puriso,
dhanajāniṃ nigacchati.

dhanañjānīsutta

dhanatthaddha

adj. proud of one’s wealth [dhana + thaddha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning proud of one’s wealth
Construction dhana + thaddha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhanena + thaddha)
Commentary (SNPa) jātitthaddho nāma yo, ahaṃ jātisampanno'ti mānaṃ janetvā tena thaddho vātapūritabhastā viya uddhumāto hutvā na kassaci onamati. esa nayo dhanagottatthaddhesu.
Sanskrit dhana + stabdha

Example

jātitthaddho dhanatthaddho,
gottatthaddho ca yo naro,
saññātiṃ atimaññeti,
taṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

SNP 6 parābhavasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 6
dhanatthaṃ

ind. for wealth; for riches; lit. for the sake of wealth [dhana + attha + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of dhanattha
Meaning for wealth; for riches; lit. for the sake of wealth
Construction dhana + attha + aṃ
dhanattha + aṃ
Sanskrit dhana + artham

Example

yaññ'atthaṃ vā dhan'atthaṃ vā,
ye hanāma mayaṃ pure,
avase taṃ bhayaṃ hoti,
vedhanti vilapanti ca.

dhanatthika

dhanadhañña

nt. wealth and grain; material and agricultural resources [dhana + dhañña] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning wealth and grain; material and agricultural resources
Construction dhana + dhañña
Compound dvanda (dhana ca dhañña ca)
Commentary (SNa) godhan'ādīnañ'ca sattavidhadhaññānañ'ca pahūtatāya pahūtadhanadhaññā.
Sanskrit dhana + dhanya

Example

ye'pi te, mahārāja, khattiyamahāsālā aḍḍhā mahaddhanā mahābhogā pahūtajātarūparajatā pahūtavitt'ūpakaraṇā pahūtadhanadhaññā, tesam'pi jātānaṃ n'atthi aññatra jarāmaraṇā.

Example

dhanapālo nāma kuñjaro,

dhanavant

adj. wealthy; rich; lit. having wealth quality [√dhan + a + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, from dhana
Meaning wealthy; rich; lit. having wealth quality
Root Family √dhan
Root √dhan×1 a (be rich)
Construction √dhan + a + vant
dhana + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Synonym aḍḍha, aḍḍhī, adalidda, adaḷidda, bhogavant, bhogī, mahaddhana, sadhana
Sanskrit dhanavat
Sanskrit Root √dhan 3 (bear fruit)

Example

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, puriso daliddo'va samāno aḍḍhavādaṃ vadeyya, adhano'va samāno dhanavāvādaṃ vadeyya, abhogo'va samāno bhogavāvādaṃ vadeyya.

Example

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, puriso daliddo'va samāno aḍḍhavādaṃ vadeyya, adhano'va samāno dhanavāvādaṃ vadeyya, abhogo'va samāno bhogavāvādaṃ vadeyya.

dhanasutta

dhanahāraka

dhanahetu

ind. for the sake of wealth [dhana + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for the sake of wealth
Construction dhana + hetu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhanassa + hetu)

Example

attahetu parahetu,
dhanahetu ca yo naro,
sakkhipuṭṭho musā brūti,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7
dhanāyati

pr. (+acc) takes as one's possession; treasures; considers to be of value [√dhan + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, deno of dhana, trans (+acc)
Meaning takes as one's possession; treasures; considers to be of value
Root Family √dhan
Root √dhan×1 a (be rich)
Base √dhan + a + āya > dhanāya (deno)
Construction dhanāya + ti
Commentary (MNa) dhanāyethā'ti dhanaṃ viya icchantā gedhaṃ āpajjeyyātha.
Sanskrit dhanāyati
Sanskrit Root √dhan 3 (bear fruit)

Example

imaṃ ce tumhe, bhikkhave, diṭṭhiṃ evaṃ parisuddhaṃ evaṃ pariyodātaṃ allīyetha kelāyetha dhanāyetha mamāyetha, api nu me tumhe, bhikkhave, kull'ūpamaṃ dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājāneyyātha nittharaṇ'atthāya no gahaṇ'atthāyā'ti?

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
dhanāsā

fem. craving for wealth ✗
dhanika

masc. wealthy man; creditor; owner [√dhan + a + ika] ✓

Grammar masc, from dhana
Meaning wealthy man; creditor; owner
Root Family √dhan
Root √dhan×1 a (be rich)
Construction √dhan + a + ika
dhana + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Sanskrit dhanika
Sanskrit Root √dhan 3 (bear fruit)

Example

kadā iṇ'aṭṭo'va daliddako nidhiṃ,
ārādhayitvā dhanikehi pīḷito,
tuṭṭho bhavissaṃ adhigamma sāsanaṃ,
mah'esino taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
dhaniṭṭhaka

masc. family name; example of a low name ~

Grammar masc
Meaning family name; example of a low name
Synonym avakaṇṇaka, kulavaḍḍhaka, javakaṇṇaka, saviṭṭhaka
Commentary (VBt) dhaniṭṭhakaṃ dhanavaḍḍhakanāmaṃ, sirivaḍḍhakanāmaṃ
dhanita 1

nt. sound [√dhan] ✗
dhanita 2

pp. (gram) (of a consonant) aspirated; lit. sounded [√dhan + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of dhaneti
Meaning (gram) (of a consonant) aspirated; lit. sounded
Root Family √dhan
Root √dhan×8 *e (sound)
Construction √dhan + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Antonym sithila
Sanskrit dhvanita
Sanskrit Root √dhvan 1 (sound)

Example

ettha ca vaggānaṃ dutiyacatutthā dhanitā'ti'pi vuccanti, itare sithilā'ti.

padarūpasiddhi sandhikaṇḍa
dhaniya

masc. name of a monk infamous for the second pārājika [√dhan + a + iya] ~

Grammar masc, from dhana
Meaning name of a monk infamous for the second pārājika
Root Family √dhan
Root √dhan×1 a (be rich)
Construction √dhan + a + iya
dhana + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Sanskrit Root √dhan 3 (bear fruit)
dhaniyattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 173 (TH173) ✗
dhaniyasutta

nt. Sutta Nipāta 1.2 (SNP 2) ✗
dhanī 1

masc. wealthy person; rich man [√dhan + a + ī] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from dhana
Meaning wealthy person; rich man
Root Family √dhan
Root √dhan×1 a (be rich)
Construction √dhan + a + ī
dhana + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Sanskrit dhanin
Sanskrit Root √dhan 3 (bear fruit)

Example

ajinamhi haññate dīpi,
nāgo dantehi haññate,
dhanamhi dhanino hanti,
aniketamasanthavaṃ,
phalī ambo aphalo ca,
te satthāro ubho mama.

JA 539 mahājanaka jātakaṃ
dhanī 2

adj. wealthy [√dhan] ✗
dhanu 1

nt. bow ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning bow
Synonym cāpa
Sanskrit dhanus

Examples

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, evarūpo javo ahosi, seyyathā'pi nāma daḷhadhammo dhanuggaho sikkhito katahattho kat'ūpāsano lahukena asanena appakasirena tiriyaṃ tālacchāyaṃ atipāteyya.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

dhanumhā ca āpaccayo hoti samās'ante. gāṇḍīvo dhanu yassa so'yaṃ gāṇḍīvadhanvā.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 340
dhanu 2

nt. bow-length; bow measure ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning bow-length; bow measure
Sanskrit dhanus

Example

yāni kho pana tāni āraññakāni sen'āsanānī'ti āraññakaṃ nāma sen'āsanaṃ pañcadhanusatikaṃ pacchimaṃ.

VIN 1.4.3.9 sāsaṅkasikkhāpadaṃ
dhanu 3

nt. bowmanship; archery ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning bowmanship; archery
Sanskrit dhanus

Example

yathā, mahārāja, mahiyā rājaputtānaṃ hatthi-assa-ratha-dhanu-tharu-lekha-muddā-sikkhā-khagga-manta-suti-sammuti-yuddha-yujjhāpana-kiriyā karaṇīyā, avasesānaṃ puthu-vessa-suddānaṃ kasi vaṇijjā gorakkhā karaṇīyā

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
dhanu 4

nt. measure of length (2000 dhanu = 1 kosa) [dhanu] ✗
dhanuācariya

masc. archery instructor [dhanu + ācariya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning archery instructor
Construction dhanu + ācariya
dhanuka

nt. toy bow; game of bows and arrows; lit. small bow [dhanu + ka] ✓

Grammar nt, dimin of dhanu
Meaning toy bow; game of bows and arrows; lit. small bow
Construction dhanu + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (MNa) dhanukam'pi khuddakadhanum'eva.
Sanskrit dhanuṣka

Example

sa kho so, bhikkhave, kumāro vuddhim'anvāya indriyānaṃ paripākam'anvāya yāni tāni kumārakānaṃ kīḷāpanakāni tehi kīḷati, seyyath'idaṃ, vaṅkakaṃ ghaṭikaṃ mokkhacikaṃ ciṅgulakaṃ patt'āḷhakaṃ rathakaṃ dhanukaṃ.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
dhanukalāpa

nt. bow and quiver [dhanu + kalāpa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bow and quiver
Construction dhanu + kalāpa
Compound dvanda (dhanu ca kalāpa ca)
Sanskrit dhanus + kalāpa

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ kāmānam'eva hetu asicammaṃ gahetvā, dhanukalāpaṃ sannayhitvā, ubhatobyūḷhaṃ saṅgāmaṃ pakkhandanti usūsu'pi khippamānesu, sattīsu'pi khippamānāsu, asīsu'pi vijjotalantesu.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ

asi ca cammañ'ca asicammaṃ, dhanu ca kalāpo ca dhanukalāpaṃ, hatthī ca asso ca hatthiassaṃ, ratho ca pattiko ca rathapattikaṃ. evaṃ sen'aṅg'atthe.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 322
dhanukāra

masc. bow-maker ✗
dhanuketakī

masc. screw-maker ✗
dhanuggaha

masc. archer; (comm) teacher of archery; lit. holding a bow [dhanu + gaha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning archer; (comm) teacher of archery; lit. holding a bow
Construction dhanu + gaha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhanuṃ + gaha)
Commentary (SNa) dhanuggaho'ti dhanuācariyo. (ANa) dhanuggaho'ti issāso.
Sanskrit dhanurgraha

Examples

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, evarūpo javo ahosi, seyyathā'pi nāma daḷhadhammā dhanuggaho sikkhito katahattho kat'ūpāsano lahukena asanena appakasirena tiriyaṃ tālacchāyaṃ atipāteyya.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, cattāro daḷhadhammā dhanuggahā susikkhitā katahatthā kat'ūpāsanā catuddisā ṭhitā assu.

SN 20.6 dhanuggahasuttaṃ
dhanuggahasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 20.6 (SN20.6) ✗
dhanupākāra

masc. enclosure of bows; encircling wall of bows ✗

nt. one hundred bow-lengths ✗

Meaning distinguished by (the mark of a) bow, spear, stake, etc.
Construction dhanu + satti + sūla + ādi + bheda
dhanusippa

nt. art of shooting ✗
dhanta 1

pp. blown; fanned; kindled [√dham + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of dhamati
Meaning blown; fanned; kindled
Root Family √dham
Root √dham･1 a (blow, sound)
Construction √dham + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change m > n
Variant adhanta
Sanskrit dhamita
Sanskrit Root √dhmā √dham 1, 2 (blow)

Example

taṃ hoti jātarūpaṃ dhantaṃ sandhantaṃ niddhantaṃ aniddhantaṃ anihitaṃ aninnītakasāvaṃ, na c'eva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ, na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca, na ca sammā upeti kammāya.

dhanta 2

dhama

masc. (+acc) blower; player; who sounds [√dham + a] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from dhamati (+acc)
Meaning blower; player; who sounds
Root Family √dham
Root √dham･1 a (blow, sound)
Construction √dham + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym dhamaka
Commentary (DNa) saṅkhadhamo'ti saṅkhadhamako.
Sanskrit dhma
Sanskrit Root √dhmā √dham 1, 2 (blow)

Example

seyyathā'pi balavā saṅkhadhamo appakasiren'eva catuddisā viññāpeyya, evam'eva kho evaṃ bhāvitāya mettāya cetovimuttiyā yaṃ pamāṇakataṃ kammaṃ na taṃ tatr'āvasissati, na taṃ tatr'āvatiṭṭhati.

masc. filtering-cup ✗

DHP 395 brāhmaṇavaggo
dhamanisantha

adj. covered, spread with veins; with prominent veins; i.e. emaciated ✗

adj. covered with veins [dhamani + santhata] ✓

Meaning covered with veins
Construction dhamani + santhata

Commentary (THa) dhamanisanthato'ti dhamanīhi santhatagatto appamaṃsalohitatāya pākaṭīhi kaṇḍarasirāhi vitatasarīro.

Examples

ekaṃ vanasmiṃ jhāyantaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 395 brāhmaṇavaggo

kālapabb'aṅgasaṅkāso,
kiso dhamanisanthato,
mattaññū annapānamhi,
adīnamanaso naro.

dhamanisanthatagatta

dhamanta

prp. blowing, sounding, kindling [√dham] ✗

prp. (+acc) blowing; blasting; pumping air [√dham + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of dhamati, trans (+acc)
Meaning blowing; blasting; pumping air

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
dhamāpeti

pr. blows, sounds [√dham] ✗

prp. blowing, sounding [√dham] ✗
dhamesi

aor. blew, sounded [√dham] ✗
dhamma 1.01

masc. nature; character [√dhar + ma] ✓

Grammar masc, from dharati
Meaning nature; character
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Phonetic Change r > m
Synonym sabhāva
Sanskrit dharma
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

atthi nu kho bhante kiñci rūpaṃ yaṃ rūpaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati

SN 22.97 nakhasikhāsuttaṃ

gāth'ābhigītaṃ me abhojaneyyaṃ,
sampassataṃ brāhmaṇa n'esa dhammo,
gāth'ābhigītaṃ panudanti buddhā,
dhamme satī brāhmaṇa vutti'r'esā.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
dhamma 1.02

masc. quality; characteristic; trait; inherent quality [√dhar + ma] ✓

Grammar masc, from dharati
Meaning quality; characteristic; trait; inherent quality
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Phonetic Change r > m
Synonym guṇa
Sanskrit dharma
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde acchariyā abbhutā dhammā, ye disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti. katame aṭṭha?

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato thero bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ appiyo ca hoti amanāpo ca agaru ca abhāvanīyo ca

AN 5.81 rajanīyasuttaṃ
dhamma 1.03

masc. teaching; discourse; doctrine [√dhar + ma] ✓

Grammar masc, from dharati
Meaning teaching; discourse; doctrine
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Phonetic Change r > m
Antonym adhamma
Synonym pariyāya, suttanta
Commentary (VIN 2.5.1.4) dhammo nāma buddhabhāsito, sāvakabhāsito, isibhāsito, devatābhāsito, atth'ūpasañhito, dhamm'ūpasañhito. (DNa) dhamman'ti suttaṃ.
Sanskrit dharma
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

imāni cattāri ariyasaccānī'ti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṃkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhī'ti. iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttan'ti.

AN 3.62 titthāyatanādisuttaṃ

idh'eva suddhi iti vādayanti,
n'āññesu dhammesu visuddhim'āhu,
yaṃ nissitā tattha subhaṃ vadānā,
paccekasaccesu puthū niviṭṭhā.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
dhamma 1.04

masc. mental phenomena; thoughts [√dhar + ma] ✓

Grammar masc, normally pl dhammā, from dharati
Meaning mental phenomena; thoughts
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Phonetic Change r > m
Sanskrit dharma
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

yassa loke sakaṃ n'atthi,
asatā ca na socati,
dhammesu ca na gacchati,
sa ve santo'ti vuccatī'ti.

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10

manasā dhammaṃ viññāya piyarūpe dhamme adhimuccati, appiyarūpe dhamme byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
dhamma 1.05

masc. mental states [√dhar + ma] ✓

Grammar masc, normally pl dhammā, from dharati
Meaning mental states
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Phonetic Change r > m
Sanskrit dharma
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce pasannena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ sukhamanveti,
chāyā'va anapāyinī.

DHP 2 yamakavaggo

tañ'ca cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti, yatth'assa te uppannā pāpakā akusalā dhammā aparisesā nirujjhanti.

Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

pāragū hoti brāhmaṇo,
ath'assa sabbe saṃyogā,
atthaṃ gacchanti jānato.

DHP 384 brāhmaṇavaggo

atthaṅ'gato so uda vā so n'atthi,
udāhu ve sassatiyā arogo,
taṃ me munī sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.

pārāyanavaggo 6

na hi verena verāni,
sammant'īdha kudācanaṃ,
averena ca sammanti,
esa dhammo sanantano.

āratī viratī pāpā,
majjapānā ca saṃyamo,
appamādo ca dhammesu,
etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.

yo pana bhikkhu anvaddhamāsaṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṃ vadeyya, idān'eva kho ahaṃ jānāmi, ayam'pi kira dhammo sutt'āgato suttapariyāpanno anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchatī'ti.

VIN PAT PC 73 mohanasikkhāpadaṃ

Examples

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ

kiñ'ca, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca, byādhidhammo'mhi, byādhiṃ anatīto'ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā?

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
dhamma 1.12

nt. teaching; discourse; doctrine [√dhar + ma] ✓

Meaning teaching; discourse; doctrine

Example

vippasanno anāvilo,

vippasīdanti paṇḍitā.

DHP 82 paṇḍitavaggo
dhamma 1.13

masc. religion [√dhar + ma] ✓

Grammar masc, from dharati
Meaning religion
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Phonetic Change r > m
Sanskrit dharma
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Example

yā tā māturakkhitā piturakkhitā mātāpiturakkhitā bhāturakkhitā bhaginirakkhitā ñātirakkhitā gottarakkhitā dhammarakkhitā sasāmikā saparidaṇḍā antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittā'pi

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
dhamma 1.14

masc. act; practice [√dhar + ma] ✓

Grammar masc, from dharati
Meaning act; practice
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Phonetic Change r > m
Sanskrit dharma
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, tath'āhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, yathā ye'me antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā, te paṭisevato n'ālaṃ antarāyāyā'ti

VIN PAT PC 68 ariṭṭhasikkhāpadaṃ

abrahmacariyaṃ pahāya brahmacārī hoti ārācārī virato methunā gāmadhammā.

MN 51 kandarakasuttaṃ
dhamma 1.15

masc. duty; obligation [√dhar + ma] ✓

Grammar masc, from dharati
Meaning duty; obligation
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Commentary (PVa) tattha ñātidhammo'ti ñātīhi ñātīnaṃ kattabbakaraṇaṃ.
Sanskrit dharma
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Example

so ñātidhammo ca ayaṃ nidassito,
petāna'pūjā ca katā uḷārā,
balañ'ca bhikkhūnam'anuppadinnaṃ,
tumhehi puññaṃ pasutaṃ anappakan'ti.

KHP 7 tirokuṭṭasuttaṃ
dhamma 2.1

adj. having a bow [dhanu + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from dhanu
Meaning having a bow
Construction dhanu + a > dhanva > dhamma
Derivative taddhita (a)
Phonetic Change nu > nv > mm
Sanskrit dhanvan

Examples

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, evarūpo javo ahosi, seyyathā'pi nāma daḷhadhammo dhanuggaho sikkhito katahattho kat'ūpāsano lahukena asanena appakasirena tiriyaṃ tālacchāyaṃ atipāteyya.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, cattāro daḷhadhammā dhanuggahā susikkhitā katahatthā kat'ūpāsanā catuddisā ṭhitā assu.

SN 20.6 dhanuggahasuttaṃ
dhammakathā

fem. Dhamma discourse; discussion about the nature of things [dhamma + kathā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning Dhamma discourse; discussion about the nature of things
Construction dhamma + kathā
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + kathā)
Sanskrit dharmakathā

Example

tadā sāvatthiyaṃ satta manussakoṭiyo vasanti. tesu satthu dhammakathaṃ sutvā pañcakoṭimattā manussā ariyasāvakā jātā, dvekoṭimattā manussā puthujjanā.

DHPa 1.1.1 cakkhupālattheravatthu
dhammakathābandha

masc. connected series of Dhamma talks [dhammakathā + bandha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning connected series of Dhamma talks
Construction dhammakathā + bandha
Commentary (ANt) dhammakathābandhan'ti paveṇiāgataṃ pakiṇṇakadhammakathāmaggaṃ.
dhammakathika

masc. Dhamma preacher; Dhamma teacher [dhamma + kathā + ika] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning Dhamma preacher; Dhamma teacher
Construction dhamma + kathā + ika
dhammakathā + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + kathika)
Sanskrit dharma + kathika

Examples

ahaṃ kho'mhi dhammakathiko, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na dhammakathikā'ti. so tena dhammakathikattena attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, paris'āvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṃ deseti … evaṃ so ten'aṅgena paripūro hoti.

AN 10.8 jhānasuttaṃ
dhammakathikatta

nt. fact of being a Dhamma preacher [dhamma + kathā + ika + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp, from dhammakathika
Meaning fact of being a Dhamma preacher
Construction dhamma + kathā + ika + tta
dhammakathika + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Sanskrit dharma + kathika + tva

Examples

ahaṃ kho'mhi dhammakathiko, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na dhammakathikā'ti. so tena dhammakathikattena attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

so paṭipadaṃ'y'eva antaraṃ karitvā tena dhammakathikattena n'ev'attān'ukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ
dhammakathikattherā

masc. monks who supported the primacy of study over practice ✗
dhammakathikadevaputta

masc. young deity who preaches the Dhamma [dhammakathika + devaputta] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning young deity who preaches the Dhamma
Construction dhammakathika + devaputta
Sanskrit dharma + kathika + devaputra
dhammakathikapucchasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.155 (SN35.155) ✗
dhammakathikavagga

masc. Chapter 12 of the Khandasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 3 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
dhammakathikasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 12.16 (SN12.16) ✗
dhammakathikasutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.115 (SN22.115) ✗
dhammakathikasutta 3

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.139 (AN4.139) ✗
dhammakamma

nt. legally valid action; legitimate vinaya procedure [dhamma + kamma] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning legally valid action; legitimate vinaya procedure
Construction dhamma + kamma
Sanskrit dharma + karma
dhammakammasañña

adj. (+loc) perceiving (something) as a legally valid action; regarding (something) as a legitimate vinaya procedure [dhammakamma + sañña] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (something) as a legally valid action; regarding (something) as a legitimate vinaya procedure
Construction dhammakamma + sañña
dhammakammasaññī

adj. (+loc) perceiving (something) as a legally valid act; regarding (something) as a legitimate procedure [dhammakamma + saññī] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (something) as a legally valid act; regarding (something) as a legitimate procedure
Construction dhammakamma + saññī
dhammakaraka

masc. water-vessel ✗
dhammakaraṇa

masc. filtering-cup ✗
dhammakāma

adj. truth loving; Dhamma lover; (comm) loves the three baskets [dhamma + kāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning truth loving; Dhamma lover; (comm) loves the three baskets
Construction dhamma + kāma
Compound sattamī tappurisa (dhamme + kāma)
Commentary (ANa) dhamme assa kāmo sineho'ti dhammakāmo, tepiṭakaṃ buddhavacanaṃ piyāyatī'ti attho.
Sanskrit dharma + kāma

Examples

suvijāno bhavaṃ hoti,
suvijāno parābhavo,
dhammakāmo bhavaṃ hoti,
dhammadessī parābhavo.

SNP 6 parābhavasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 6

puna caparaṃ, subhūti, bhikkhu dhammakāmo hoti piyasamudāhāro abhidhamme abhivinaye uḷārapāmojjo.

AN 11.14 subhūtisuttaṃ
dhammakāya

adj. Normal body ✗
dhammakucchisamātapa

adj. having the teaching as even warmth in the belly; with Dhamma as the belly heat [dhamma + kucchi + samātapa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having the teaching as even warmth in the belly; with Dhamma as the belly heat
Construction dhamma + kucchi + samātapa
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + kucchisamātapa)
Variant dhammakucchisamāvāsa
Commentary (ANa) dhammakucchisam'ātapo'ti dhammo vuccati catutthajjhānasamādhi, kucchi'y'eva sam'ātapo kucchisam'ātapo. sam'ātapo nāma sam'ātapanaṭṭhānaṃ. dhammo kucchisam'ātapo assā'ti dhammakucchisam'ātapo.
Sanskrit dharma + kukṣi + sam + ātapa

Example

sati gīvā siro paññā,
vīmaṃsā dhammacintanā,
dhammakucchisam'ātapo,
viveko tassa vāladhi.

AN 6.43 nāgasuttaṃ
dhammakucchisamāvāsa

adj. with Dhamma residing in the belly [dhamma + kucchi + samāvāsa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with Dhamma residing in the belly
Construction dhamma + kucchi + samāvāsa
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + kucchisamāvāsa)
Variant dhammakucchisamātapa
Commentary (THa) abhiññāsamathānaṃ ādhānabhāvato samathavipassanāsaṅkhāto dhammo kucchisamāvāso etassā'ti dhammakucchisamāvāso.
Sanskrit dharma + kukṣi + samāvāsa

Example

sati gīvā siro paññā,
vīmaṃsā dhammacintanā,
dhammakucchisamāvāso,
viveko tassa vāladhi.

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā
dhammakusala

adj. skilled in the teaching ✗
dhammaketu

adj. with Dhamma as one's banner [dhamma + ketu] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with Dhamma as one's banner
Construction dhamma + ketu
dhammakkosa

masc. legitimate abuse; being righteously reviled [dhamma + akkosa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning legitimate abuse; being righteously reviled
Construction dhamma + akkosa
dhammakkhandha

masc. portion of the teaching; part of the Dhamma [dhamma + khandha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning portion of the teaching; part of the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + khandha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + khandha)
Commentary (DNa) dhammakkhandhā'ti ettha guṇ'aṭṭho khandh'aṭṭho.
Sanskrit dharmaskandha

Example

katame pañca dhammā sacchikātabbā? pañca dhammakkhandhā, sīlakkhandho, samādhikkhandho, paññākkhandho, vimuttikkhandho, vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandho. ime pañca dhammā sacchikātabbā.

DN 34.6 dasuttarasuttaṃ
dhammakkhāna

nt. preaching of the doctrine ✗
dhammagaṇḍikā

fem. block of justice; i.e., of execution ✗
dhammagata

adj. immersed in the teaching; focused on the Dhamma; lit. gone to the Dhamma [dhamma + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning immersed in the teaching; focused on the Dhamma; lit. gone to the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammaṃ + gata)
Sanskrit dharma + gata

Example

suppabuddhaṃ pabujjhanti,
sadā gotamasāvakā,
yesaṃ divā ca ratto ca,
niccaṃ dhammagatā sati.

DHP 297 pakiṇṇakavaggo
dhammagarahī

adj. blaming the Dhamma; finding fault with the teaching [dhamma + garahī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning blaming the Dhamma; finding fault with the teaching
Construction dhamma + garahī
Commentary (VINa) na mayaṃ, bhante ānanda, buddhagarahino'ti bhante ānanda, mayaṃ na buddhaṃ garahāma, na buddhassa dosaṃ dema. na dhammagarahino, na saṅghagarahino.
dhammagaru

adj. with respect for the teaching; giving weight to the Dhamma [dhamma + garu] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with respect for the teaching; giving weight to the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + garu
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + garu)
Commentary (ANa) dhammo garu assā'ti dhammagaru.
Sanskrit dhamma + guru

Example

kadā nu'haṃ sabbhi samāgamesu,
diṭṭho bhave dhammagarūhi tādibhi,
yāthāvadassīhi jit'indriyehi,
padhāniyo taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
dhammagārava 1

adj. respectful, obedient to dhamma ✗
dhammagārava 2

nt. respect for Dhamma ✗
dhammagārava 3

adj. respectful towards the teaching; giving weight to the Dhamma [dhamma + gārava] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning respectful towards the teaching; giving weight to the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + gārava
Commentary (ANa) dhammagāravatā'ti navavidhe lokuttaradhamme garubhāvo.
dhammagāravatā

fem. fact of having respect for the teaching; fact of giving weight to the Dhamma [dhamma + gāravatā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning fact of having respect for the teaching; fact of giving weight to the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + gāravatā
Commentary (ANa) dhammagāravatā'ti navavidhe lokuttaradhamme garubhāvo.
dhammagutta

adj. protected by the Dhamma ✗
dhammaghosaka

masc. who announces about the preaching of the Dhamma ✗
dhammacakka

nt. Dhamma teaching; lit. Dhamma wheel [dhamma + cakka] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Dhamma teaching; lit. Dhamma wheel
Construction dhamma + cakka
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + cakka)
Commentary (SNa) dhammacakkehi saṃyuto'ti kāyikacetasikavīriyasaṅkhātehi dhammacakkehi saṃyutto.
Sanskrit dharmacakra

Examples

ujuko nāma so maggo,
abhayā nāma sā disā,
ratho akūjano nāma,
dhammacakkehi saṃyuto.

SN 1.46 accharāsuttaṃ

tasmiṃ samaye satthā pavattitavaradhammacakko anupubben'āgantvā anāthapiṇḍikena mahāseṭṭhinā catupaṇṇāsakoṭidhanaṃ vissajjetvā kārite jetavanamahāvihāre viharati mahājanaṃ saggamagge ca mokkhamagge ca patiṭṭhāpayamāno.

DHPa 1.1.1 cakkhupālattheravatthu
dhammacakkappavattana

nt. setting the wheel of Dhamma rolling forward; turning the wheel of the teaching [dhammacakka + pavattana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning setting the wheel of Dhamma rolling forward; turning the wheel of the teaching
Construction dhammacakka + pavattana
Commentary (BVa) tattha pañcavaggiyānaṃ attano buddhabhāvaṃ pakāsetvā paññattavarabuddhāsanagato pañcavaggiye bhikkhū āmantetvā dhammacakkappavattanasuttantaṃ desesi.
Sanskrit dharmacakra + pravartana

Example

bandhumassa rañño bandhumatī nāma nagaraṃ rājadhānī ahosi. vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa evaṃ abhinikkhamanaṃ ahosi evaṃ pabbajjā evaṃ padhānaṃ evaṃ abhisambodhi evaṃ dhammacakkappavattanaṃ.

DN 14.17 mahāpadānasuttaṃ, devatārocanaṃ
dhammacakkappavattanavagga

masc. Chapter 2 of the Saccasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 5 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
dhammacakkappavattanasutta

nt. sutta in Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.11 (SN 56.11) ✗
dhammacakkhu

nt. insight into the nature of reality; spiritual insight; understanding of the way things are; lit. Dhamma eye [dhamma + cakkhu] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning insight into the nature of reality; spiritual insight; understanding of the way things are; lit. Dhamma eye
Construction dhamma + cakkhu
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + cakkhu)
Sanskrit dharmacakṣus

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ samma'd'eva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, evam'eva tesaṃ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṃ tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi, yaṃ kiñci samudayadhammaṃ sabbaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti

DN 14.14 mahāpadānasuttaṃ

khat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. upahat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā pitaraṃ dhammikaṃ dhammarājānaṃ jīvitā na voropessatha, imasmiññ'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ uppajjissathā'ti.

DN 2.32 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ
dhammacakkhupaṭilābha

masc. acquiring insight into the nature of reality; gaining spiritual insight [dhammacakkhu + paṭilābha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning acquiring insight into the nature of reality; gaining spiritual insight
Construction dhammacakkhu + paṭilābha
dhammacariyasutta

nt. Sutta Nipāta 2.6 (SNP 18) ✗
dhammacariyā

fem. conduct in line with the Dhamma; ethical conduct; moral behaviour [dhamma + cariyā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning conduct in line with the Dhamma; ethical conduct; moral behaviour
Construction dhamma + cariyā
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + cariyā)
Antonym adhammacariyā
Sanskrit dharmacaryā

Examples

dānañ'ca dhammacariyā ca,
ñātakānañ'ca saṅgaho,
anavajjāni kammāni,
etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.

KHP 5 maṅgalasuttaṃ

ime ca, mahāli, dasa dhammā loke na saṃvijjeyyuṃ, na'y'idha paññāyetha adhammacariyāvisamacariyā'ti vā dhammacariyāsamacariyā'ti vā.

AN 10.47 mahālisuttaṃ
dhammacariyābhirata

adj. who takes extreme pleasure in ethical conduct; very fond of conduct in line with the Dhamma [dhammacariyā + abhirata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who takes extreme pleasure in ethical conduct; very fond of conduct in line with the Dhamma
Construction dhammacariyā + abhirata
dhammacariyāsamacariyā

fem. ethical and moral conduct; good conduct and wholesome behaviour [dhammacariyā + samacariyā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning ethical and moral conduct; good conduct and wholesome behaviour
Construction dhammacariyā + samacariyā
Compound dvanda (dhammacariyā ca samacariyā ca)
Antonym adhammacariyāvisamacariyā
Sanskrit dharmacaryā + sama + caryā

Example

tividhaṃ kho, gahapatayo, kāyena dhammacariyāsamacariyā hoti, catubbidhaṃ vācāya dhammacariyāsamacariyā hoti, tividhaṃ manasā dhammacariyāsamacariyā hoti.

MN 41 sāleyyakasuttaṃ
dhammacariyāsamacariyāhetu

ind. because of ethical and moral conduct; due to good conduct and wholesome behaviour [dhammacariyā + samacariyā + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning because of ethical and moral conduct; due to good conduct and wholesome behaviour
Construction dhammacariyā + samacariyā + hetu
Compound abyayībhāva (dhammacariyāsamacariyā + hetu)
Antonym adhammacariyāvisamacariyāhetu
Sanskrit dharmacaryā + sama + caryā + hetu

Example

dhammacariyāsamacariyāhetu kho, gahapatayo, evam'idh'ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjantī'ti.

MN 41 sāleyyakasuttaṃ
dhammacāga

masc. generosity with the teaching; Dhamma sharing [dhamma + cāga] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning generosity with the teaching; Dhamma sharing
Construction dhamma + cāga
Antonym āmisacāga
Synonym dhammapariccāga
Commentary (ANa) āmisassa cajanaṃ āmisacāgo, dhammassa cajanaṃ dhammacāgo.
dhammacārī 1

adj. who lives the Dhamma; who practices the teaching; who walks in truth [dhamma + cārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who lives the Dhamma; who practices the teaching; who walks in truth
Construction dhamma + cārī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammaṃ + cārī)
Antonym adhammacārī
Sanskrit dharmacārin

Examples

uttiṭṭhe nappamajjeyya,
dhammaṃ sucaritaṃ care,
dhammacārī sukhaṃ seti,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca.

DHP 168 lokavaggo

dhammo have rakkhati dhammacāriṃ,
dhammo suciṇṇo sukham'āvahati.
es'ānisaṃso dhamme suciṇṇe,
na duggatiṃ gacchati dhammacārī.

TH 195 dhammikattheragāthā
dhammacārī 2

masc. virtuous person; righteous man [dhamma + cārī] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning virtuous person; righteous man
Construction dhamma + cārī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammaṃ + cārī)
Antonym adhammacārī
Commentary (MNa) dhammacārī'ti dhammikasivavijj'ādikammakārī. (JAa) dhammacārī'ti dasakusalakammapathadhammacārī.
Sanskrit dharmacārin

Example

ākaṅkheyya ce, gahapatayo, dhammacārī samacārī, aho vat'āhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā khattiyamahāsālānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan'ti, ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ vijjati, yaṃ so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā khattiyamahāsālānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.

MN 41 sāleyyakasuttaṃ
dhammacārī 3

adj. virtuous ✗
dhammacintana

nt. thinking about the Dhamma; examination of phenomena [dhamma + cintana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning thinking about the Dhamma; examination of phenomena
Construction dhamma + cintana
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammaṃ + cintana)
Sanskrit dharma + cintana

Example

sati gīvā siro paññā,
vīmaṃsā dhammacintanā,
dhammakucchisamāvāso,
viveko tassa vāladhi.

Construction dhamma + cudita

dhammacetiya

nt. shrine in which sacred texts are enshrined ✗
dhammacetiyasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 89 (MN89) ✗
dhammacodaka

adj. (a monk) who accuses (someone) of an offence properly, by the rules ✗
dhammacchanda

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning interest in mental phenomena; desire for thoughts
Construction dhamma + chanda
dhammaja

adj. born from Dhamma; born of the teaching; lit. born from nature [dhamma + ja] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning born from Dhamma; born of the teaching; lit. born from nature
Construction dhamma + ja
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (dhammasmā + ja)
Sanskrit dharma + ja

Example

tassa me tumhe puttā orasā mukhato jātā dhammajā dhammanimmitā dhammadāy'ādā, no āmisadāy'ādā.

ITI 100 brāhmaṇadhammayāgasuttaṃ
dhammajāla

nt. net of the teaching ✗
dhammajīvī

adj. morally upright; living ethically; righteous; lit. who lives the Dhamma [dhamma + jīvī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning morally upright; living ethically; righteous; lit. who lives the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + jīvī
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + jīvī)
Sanskrit dharma + jīvin

Examples

uṭṭhānavato satīmato,
sucikammassa nisammakārino,
saññatassa dhammajīvino,
appamattassa yaso'bhivaḍḍhati.

DHP 24 appamādavaggo

pakkamissañ'ca nāḷāto,
ko'dha nāḷāya vacchati,
bandhantī itthirūpena,
samaṇe dhammajīvino.

THI 68 ekudāniyattheragāthā
dhammaññū

adj. who knows the doctrine ✗
dhammaññūsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 7.68 (AN7.68) ✗
dhammaṭṭaṭṭhāna

nt. law court; court of justice; lit. justice case place [dhamma + aṭṭa + ṭhāna] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning law court; court of justice; lit. justice case place
Construction dhamma + aṭṭa + ṭhāna
Sanskrit dharmādhikaraṇasthāna,
dhammaṭṭha

adj. firmly established in the Dhamma; righteous; just; moral; virtuous; lit. standing on Dhamma [dhamma + ṭha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning firmly established in the Dhamma; righteous; just; moral; virtuous; lit. standing on Dhamma
Construction dhamma + ṭha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (dhamme + ṭṭha)
Synonym dhammika, dhammiya, dhammī, sīlavatī, sīlavant, sugatī
Commentary (SNa) dhammaṭṭhā sīlasampannā'ti tasmiṃ dhamme ṭhitattā tena'pi sīlena sampannattā dhammaṭṭhā sīlasampannā. (DHPa) dhammaṭṭhan'ti navavidhalokuttaradhamme ṭhitaṃ, sacchikatalokuttaradhamman'ti attho. (SNPa) dhammaṭṭho'ti catusaccadhamme ṭhito.
Sanskrit dharmiṣṭha

Examples

sīladassanasampannaṃ,
dhammaṭṭhaṃ saccavedinaṃ,
attano kamma kubbānaṃ,
taṃ jano kurute piyaṃ.

DHP 217 piyavaggo

kesaṃ divā ca ratto ca,
sadā puññaṃ pavaḍḍhati,
dhammaṭṭhā sīlasampannā,
ke janā saggagāmino'ti.

SN 1.47 vanaropasuttaṃ
dhammaṭṭhapaṭisaṃyutta

adj. firmly established in and connected with the Dhamma [dhammaṭṭha + paṭisaṃyutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning firmly established in and connected with the Dhamma
Construction dhammaṭṭha + paṭisaṃyutta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhammaṭṭhena + paṭisaṃyutta)
Commentary (ANa) dhammaṭṭhapaṭisaṃyuttā'ti yā ca dhamme ṭhitena kathitakathā, sā dhammaṭṭhā c'eva hoti tena ca dhammena paṭisaṃyuttā'ti dhammaṭṭhapaṭisaṃyuttā.
dhammaṭṭhavagga

masc. Chapter 19 of the Dhammapada (DHP 19) ✗
dhammaṭṭhitatā

fem. regularity of natural principles [dhamma + ṭhitatā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning regularity of natural principles
Construction dhamma + ṭhitatā
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + ṭhitatā)
Sanskrit dharma + sthitatā

Example

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā
dhammaṭṭhiti

fem. real nature of the Dhamma ✗
dhammaṭṭhitiñāṇa

nt. knowledge of relationship of ideas or states, knowledge of structure of ideas or states (term for dependent origination) ✗
dhammatakka

masc. reflection on the Dhamma; (comm) right intention; lit. Dhamma thought [dhamma + takka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning reflection on the Dhamma; (comm) right intention; lit. Dhamma thought
Construction dhamma + takka
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + takka)
Commentary (ANa) dhammatakkapurejavan'ti dhammatakko vuccati sammāsaṅkappo, so ādito hoti, purato hoti, pubbaṅ'gamo hoti aññāvimokkhassā'ti dhammatakkapurejavo.
Sanskrit dharma + tarka

Example

upekkhāsatisaṃsuddhaṃ,
dhammatakkapurejavaṃ,
aññāvimokkhaṃ pabrūmi,
avijjāya pabhedanaṃ.

SNP 68 udaya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 13
dhammatakkapurejava

adj. headed by reflection on the teaching; with thoughts about the Dhamma leading the way; (comm) preceded by right view or right intention [dhammatakka + purejava] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning headed by reflection on the teaching; with thoughts about the Dhamma leading the way; (comm) preceded by right view or right intention
Construction dhammatakka + purejava
Commentary (NIDD2) dhammatakkapurejavan'ti dhammatakko vuccati sammāsaṅkappo. so ādito hoti, purato hoti, pubbaṅ'gamo hoti aññāvimokkhassā'ti, evam'pi dhammatakkapurejavaṃ. atha vā, dhammatakko vuccati sammādiṭṭhi. sā ādito hoti, purato hoti, pubbaṅ'gamo hoti aññāvimokkhassā'ti, evam'pi dhammatakkapurejavaṃ.
dhammataṇhā

fem. craving for mental phenomena [dhamma + taṇhā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning craving for mental phenomena
Construction dhamma + taṇhā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (dhammesu + taṇhā)
Sanskrit dharma + tṛṣṇā

Examples

katamā ca, bhikkhave, taṇhā? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, taṇhākāyā, rūpataṇhā, saddataṇhā, gandhataṇhā, rasataṇhā, phoṭṭhabbataṇhā, dhammataṇhā. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, taṇhā.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

rūpataṇhā... saddataṇhā... gandhataṇhā... rasataṇhā... phoṭṭhabbataṇhā... dhammataṇhā loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ, etth'esā taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati, ettha nivisamānā nivisati

DN 22.16 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
dhammatā esā

idiom. (+gen) this is natural (for); this is the nature (of); this is the character (of); this is normal (for) ✓

Grammar idiom, fem + pron (+gen)
Meaning this is natural (for); this is the nature (of); this is the character (of); this is normal (for)
Sanskrit dharmatā + eṣā

Examples

sīlavato, bhikkhave, sīlasampannassa na cetanāya karaṇīyaṃ, avippaṭisāro me uppajjatū'ti. dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yaṃ sīlavato sīlasampannassa avippaṭisāro uppajjati.

AN 10.2 cetanākaraṇīyasuttaṃ

dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa, kiñ'cā'pi tathārūpiṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, yathārūpāya āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṃ paññāyati, atha kho naṃ khippam'eva satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu deseti vivarati uttānīkaroti, desetvā vivaritvā uttānīkatvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjati.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
dhammatā 1

fem. nature; character; characteristic; attribute [√dhar + ma + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from dhamma
Meaning nature; character; characteristic; attribute
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma + tā
dhamma + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Phonetic Change r > m
Commentary (MNa) dhammatāyā'ti sabhāvena.
Sanskrit dharmatā
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

sabbe saddhammagaruno,
vihaṃsu viharanti ca,
tath'āpi viharissanti,
esā buddhāna dhammatā.

SN 6.2 gāravasuttaṃ

tassā hi nāma, āvuso, bāhirāya pathavīdhātuyā tāva mahallikāya aniccatā paññāyissati, khayadhammatā paññāyissati, vayadhammatā paññāyissati, vipariṇāmadhammatā paññāyissati.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
dhammatā 2

fem. universal law; nature of the Dhamma; lit. Dhamma-ness [√dhar + ma + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from dhamma
Meaning universal law; nature of the Dhamma; lit. Dhamma-ness
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma + tā
dhamma + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Phonetic Change r > m
Sanskrit dharmatā
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Example

uttamaṃ dhammataṃ patto,
sabbaloke anatthiko,
ādittā'va gharā mutto,
maraṇasmiṃ na socati.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā
dhammatā 3

fem. usual way; normal practice [√dhar] ✗
dhammatārūpa

nt. natural form; i.e. stones, trees, etc. ✗

adj. well investigated according to character; thoroughly scrutinized regarding qualities [dhammatā + susamanniṭṭha] ✓

Meaning well investigated according to character; thoroughly scrutinized regarding qualities

Example

evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tathāgate dhammasamannesanā hoti. evañ'ca pana tathāgato dhammatāsusamanniṭṭho hotī'ti.

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning seeing the Dhamma; understanding the teaching
Construction dhamma + dassana
Commentary (SNa) dhammadassanan'ti padena dhamme pasādo gahito'ti evaṃ cattāri sot'āpattiy'aṅgāni vuttāni.
dhammadāna

nt. gift of Dhamma; gift of the teaching [dhamma + dāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning gift of Dhamma; gift of the teaching
Construction dhamma + dāna
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammaṃ + dāna)
Antonym āmisadāna
Commentary (ANa) dhammadānan'ti idh'ekacco amatapattipaṭipadaṃ kathetvā deti, idaṃ dhammadānaṃ nāma.
Sanskrit dharmadāna

Examples

sabbadānaṃ dhammadānaṃ jināti,
sabbarasaṃ dhammaraso jināti,
sabbaratiṃ dhammarati jināti,
taṇhakkhayo sabbadukkhaṃ jināti.

DHP 354 taṇhāvaggo

dve'māni, bhikkhave, dānāni āmisadānañ'ca dhammadānañ'ca. etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ dānānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammadānaṃ.

tumhe ca me bhikkhave āmisadāy'ādā bhaveyyātha no dhammadāy'ādā, tumhe'pi tena ādiyā bhaveyyātha, āmisadāy'ādā satthusāvakā viharanti, no dhammadāy'ādā'ti

bahussuto dhammadharo, bahussuto dhammadharo'ti, bhante, vuccati. kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, bahussuto dhammadharo hotī'ti?

AN 4.186 ummaggasuttaṃ
dhammadhātu 1

fem. nature of reality; way things are [dhamma + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning nature of reality; way things are
Construction dhamma + dhātu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammānaṃ + dhātu)
Commentary (MNa) dhammadhātū'ti dhammasabhāvo. sabbaññutaññāṇassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. taṃ bhagavatā suppaṭividdhaṃ, hatthagataṃ bhagavato.
Sanskrit dharmadhātu

Example

sā hi, rājakumāra, tathāgatassa dhammadhātu suppaṭividdhā yassā dhammadhātuyā suppaṭividdhattā ṭhānaso'v'etaṃ tathāgataṃ paṭibhātī'ti.

MN 58 abhayarājakumārasuttaṃ
dhammadhātu 2

fem. phenomena element; mental phenomena; lit. phenomena state [dhamma + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning phenomena element; mental phenomena; lit. phenomena state
Construction dhamma + dhātu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammānaṃ + dhātu)
Commentary (SNa) cakkhudhātū'tiādīsu ... tisso manodhātuyo manodhātu, vedanādayo tayo khandhā sukhumarūpāni nibbānañca dhammadhātu, sabbampi manoviññāṇaṃ manoviññāṇadhātūti.
Sanskrit dharmadhātu

Example

evaṃ, bhante. idaṃ kho, gahapati, dhātunānattaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā, cakkhudhātu, rūpadhātu, cakkhuviññāṇadhātu … manodhātu, dhammadhātu, manoviññāṇadhātu.

masc. rat-snake ✗

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning acceptance of the teaching after consideration; approving of the teaching after understanding it

dhammanijjhānakhanti

fem. choice after pondering over the True Idea (Dhamma); acceptance of the Dhamma as a result of reflection ✗
dhammanimantana

nt. suitable invitation; appropriate offer [dhamma + nimantana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning suitable invitation; appropriate offer
Construction dhamma + nimantana
Commentary (VINt) dhammavasena upacāravasena nimantanā dhammanimantanā'ti pāḷipadassa attho veditabbo. sace pana vadeyyātha, bhante, yen'attho'ti idaṃ saccam'eva vuttaṃ siyā, pavārito'y'eva hoti. yasmā pana pavāretvā'pi adātu'kāmo appavāritaṭṭhāne'y'eva tiṭṭhati, tasmā bhagavā pavārit'āpavāritabhāvaṃ avicāretvā ñātako te, upananda, aññātako'ti ñātakaaññātakabhāvaṃ'y'eva vicāresi.
dhammanimitta

nt. mental image of Dhamma ✗
dhammanimittaniketavisāravinibandha

adj. bound by the expanding home of mental images of mental phenomena [dhammanimitta + niketa + visāra + vinibandha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bound by the expanding home of mental images of mental phenomena
Construction dhammanimitta + niketa + visāra + vinibandha
Notes A difficult term to translate. See CPB note 22. see rūpanimittaniketavisāravinibandha
dhammanimittassādagadhita

adj. tied by gratification to the mental representation of thought [dhamma + nimitta + assāda + gadhita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning tied by gratification to the mental representation of thought
Construction dhamma + nimitta + assāda + gadhita
dhammanimittassādavinibandha

adj. chained by gratification to the mental representation of thought [dhamma + nimitta + assāda + vinibandha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning chained by gratification to the mental representation of thought
Construction dhamma + nimitta + assāda + vinibandha
dhammanimittassādasaṃyojanasaṃyutta

adj. bound with a chain by gratification to the mental representation of thought [dhamma + nimitta + assāda + saṃyojana + saṃyutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bound with a chain by gratification to the mental representation of thought
Construction dhamma + nimitta + assāda + saṃyojana + saṃyutta
dhammanimittānusārī

adj. following the mental representations of thoughts [dhamma + nimitta + anusārī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning following the mental representations of thoughts
Construction dhamma + nimitta + anusārī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammanimittaṃ + anusārī)
dhammanimmita

adj. created by the Dhamma; fashioned from the Dhamma [dhamma + nimmita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning created by the Dhamma; fashioned from the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + nimmita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhammena + nimmita)
Sanskrit dharma + nimitta

Example

tassa me tumhe puttā orasā mukhato jātā dhammajā dhammanimmitā dhammadāy'ādā, no āmisadāy'ādā.

ITI 100 brāhmaṇadhammayāgasuttaṃ
dhammaniyāma

masc. order of the Dhamma ✗
dhammaniyāmatā

fem. invariance of natural principles; orderliness of the teaching [dhamma + niyāmatā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning invariance of natural principles; orderliness of the teaching
Construction dhamma + niyāmatā
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + niyāmatā)
Sanskrit dharma + niyama + tā

Example

api ca samaṇo gotamo bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ tathaṃ paṭipadaṃ paññapeti dhammaṭṭhitataṃ dhammaniyāmataṃ.

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā
dhammanisantī

adj. attending carefully to dhamma ✗
dhammanissita

adj. dependent on thought [dhamma + nissita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dependent on thought
Construction dhamma + nissita
dhammanupassī

adj. observing, considering phenomena ✗
dhammanusārī

adj. who follows dhamma; who develops understanding ✗
dhammanussati

fem. calling dhamma to mind ✗
dhammanetti

fem. guidelines of the teaching; outline of the Dhamma [dhamma + netti] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning guidelines of the teaching; outline of the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + netti
Commentary (MNa) dhammanetti samanumajjitabbā'ti dhammarajju anumajjitabbā ñāṇena ghaṃsitabbā upaparikkhitabbā. sā pan'esā dhammanetti, iti kho, vaccha, ime dasa dhammā akusalā dasa dhammā kusalā'ti evaṃ mahāvacchagottasutte (ma. ni. 2.194) āgatā'ti vuttā. sā eva vā hotu, yo vā idha dhammo'ti ca vinayo ca vutto.
dhammanvaya 1

masc. the way the Dhamma goes; natural course of the teaching [dhamma + anvaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning the way the Dhamma goes; natural course of the teaching
Construction dhamma + anvaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + anvaya)
Commentary (MNa) tattha anvetī'ti anvayo, jānāti, anubujjhatī'ti attho. dhammassa anvayo dhamm'anvayo
Sanskrit dharma + anvaya

Example

ayam'pi hi nāma, sāriputta, sunakkhattassa moghapurisassa mayi dhamm'anvayo na bhavissati, iti'pi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
dhammanvaya 2

masc. necessity of an idea or principle ✗
dhammapaññatti

fem. teaching the Dhamma; communicating the teaching [dhamma + paññatti] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning teaching the Dhamma; communicating the teaching
Construction dhamma + paññatti
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammaṃ + paññatti)
Commentary (ANa) dhammapaññattiyā'ti dhammassa paññāpanāya.
Sanskrit prajñapti

Example

so tāya dhammapaññattiyā divasaṃ atināmeti, riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, n'ānuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhu, bhikkhu paññattibahulo, no dhammavihārī.

AN 5.73 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ
dhammapaṭirūpaka

nt. false representation of the teachings or the rule ✗
dhammapaṭisanthāra

masc. hospitality with the teaching [dhamma + paṭisanthāra] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning hospitality with the teaching
Construction dhamma + paṭisanthāra
Antonym āmisapaṭisanthāra
Synonym dhammasanthāra
Commentary (ADHa) dhammapaṭisanthāro'ti dhammassa appaṭilābhena attanā saha paresaṃ chiddaṃ yathā pihitaṃ hoti paṭicchannaṃ, evaṃ dhammena paṭisantharaṇaṃ.
dhammapaṭisambhidā

fem. analytical understanding of natural conditions; discriminative understanding of the teaching [dhamma + paṭisambhidā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning analytical understanding of natural conditions; discriminative understanding of the teaching
Construction dhamma + paṭisambhidā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + paṭisambhidā)
Sanskrit dharma + pratisaṃvid

Example

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthapaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, dhammapaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, niruttipaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāpatto hoti, yathāvimuttaṃ cittaṃ paccavekkhati.

AN 5.95 akuppasuttaṃ
dhammapaṭisambhidāpatta

adj. attained analytical understanding of natural conditions; reached a discriminative understanding of the teaching [dhammapaṭisambhidā + patta] ~

Meaning attained analytical understanding of natural conditions; reached a discriminative understanding of the teaching
Construction dhammapaṭisambhidā + patta
dhammapaṭisaṃyutta

adj. connected with dhamma ✗
dhammapaṭisaṃvedī

adj. experiencing the teaching [dhamma + paṭisaṃvedī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning experiencing the teaching
Construction dhamma + paṭisaṃvedī
dhammapaṇṇākāra

masc. present consisting of dhamma ✗
dhammapada 1

nt. verse of the teaching; line of Dhamma; religious saying [dhamma + pada] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning verse of the teaching; line of Dhamma; religious saying
Construction dhamma + pada
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + pada)
Notes (NPCED) portion of the teaching
Sanskrit dharma + pada

Examples

ko imaṃ pathaviṃ vicessati,
yamalokañ'ca imaṃ sadevakaṃ,
ko dhammapadaṃ sudesitaṃ,
kusalo puppham'iva pacessati.

DHP 44 pupphavaggo

yo ca gāthā sataṃ bhāse,
anatthapadasaṃhitā,
ekaṃ dhammapadaṃ seyyo,
yaṃ sutvā upasammati.

DHP 102 sahassavaggo
dhammapada 2

nt. path of Dhamma; way of the teaching; (comm) state of enlightenment [dhamma + pada] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning path of Dhamma; way of the teaching; (comm) state of enlightenment
Construction dhamma + pada
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + pada)
Commentary (SNa) dānā ca kho dhammapadaṃ'va seyyo'ti dānato nibbānasaṅkhātaṃ dhammapadam'eva seyyo.
Sanskrit dharma + pada

Example

saddhā hi dānaṃ bahudhā pasatthaṃ,
dānā ca kho dhammapadaṃ'va seyyo,
pubbe ca hi pubbatare ca santo,
nibbānam'ev'ajjhagamuṃ sapaññā'ti.

SN 1.33 sādhusuttaṃ
dhammapada 3

nt. Book 2 of the Khuddaka Nikāya; Dhamma Verses [dhamma + pada] ~

Meaning Book 2 of the Khuddaka Nikāya; Dhamma Verses
Construction dhamma + pada
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + pada)
Sanskrit dharmapada (bsk)
dhammapadapāḷi

fem. Book 2 of the Khuddaka Nikāya; Dhamma Verses ✗
dhammapadabyañjana

nt. explanation of the teaching; lit. Dhamma words and phrases [dhamma + padabyañjana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning explanation of the teaching; lit. Dhamma words and phrases
Construction dhamma + padabyañjana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + padabyañjana)
Commentary (MNa) dhammapadabyañjanan'ti pāḷiyā padabyañjanaṃ, tassa tassa atthassa byañjanakaṃ akkharaṃ.
Sanskrit dharma + pada + vyañjana

Example

aññatra asitapītakhāyitasāyitā aññatra uccārapassāvakammā, aññatra niddākilamathapaṭivinodanā apariyādinnā'y'ev'assa, sāriputta, tathāgatassa dhammadesanā, apariyādinnaṃ'y'ev'assa tathāgatassa dhammapadabyañjanaṃ, apariyādinnaṃ'y'ev'assa tathāgatassa pañhapaṭibhānaṃ.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
dhammapadasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.29 (AN4.29) ✗

Meaning generosity with the teaching; Dhamma sharing
Construction dhamma + pariccāga
Antonym āmisapariccāga
Synonym dhammacāga
dhammapariyatti

fem. Dhamma learning; scriptural study [dhamma + pariyatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning Dhamma learning; scriptural study
Construction dhamma + pariyatti
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + pariyatti)
Sanskrit dharma + paryavāpti (bsk)

Example

so tāya dhammapariyattiyā divasaṃ atināmeti, riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, n'ānuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhu, bhikkhu pariyattibahulo, no dhammavihārī.

AN 5.73 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ
dhammapariyāya

masc. Dhamma discourse; method of teaching [dhamma + pariyāya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning Dhamma discourse; method of teaching
Construction dhamma + pariyāya
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + pariyāya)
Sanskrit dharma + paryāya

Examples

nibbedhikapariyāyaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammapariyāyaṃ desessāmi. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti. evaṃ, bhante'ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ

ko nāmo ayaṃ, bhante, dhammapariyāyo'ti? tasmā't'iha tvaṃ, ānanda, imaṃ dhammapariyāyaṃ madhupiṇḍikapariyāyo tv'eva naṃ dhārehī'ti

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

dhammapāmojja

nt. happiness with the teaching; joy in the Dhamma [dhamma + pāmojja] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning happiness with the teaching; joy in the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + pāmojja
Compound sattamī tappurisa (dhamme + pāmojja)
Sanskrit dharma + prāmodya

Example

asaṃkiliṭṭhacitto nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi, saṃvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no, lābhī nu khomhi ajjhattaṃ dhammapāmojjassa, saṃvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no, lābhī nu khomhi ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa, saṃvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no

AN 10.55 parihānasuttaṃ
dhammapālattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 162 (TH162) ✗
dhammapāsādapokkharaṇī

fem. lotus ponds in the palace called Dhamma ✗
dhammapāsādappamukha

adj. with Dhamma palace as the foremost (among them) [dhamma + pāsāda + pamukha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with Dhamma palace as the foremost (among them)
Construction dhamma + pāsāda + pamukha
Compound kammadhāraya (dhammapāsāda + pamukha)
Sanskrit dharma + prāsāda + pramukha

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītipāsādasahassāni ahesuṃ dhammapāsādappamukhāni.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
dhammapīti

adj. who drinks the Dhamma; who delights in the Dhamma [dhamma + pīti] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who drinks the Dhamma; who delights in the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + pīti
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammaṃ + pīti)
Sanskrit dharma + pīti

Example

dhammapīti sukhaṃ seti,
vippasannena cetasā,
ariyappavedite dhamme,
sadā ramati paṇḍito.

DHP 79 paṇḍitavaggo
dhammapītirasa

masc. flavour of delight in the Dhamma; juice of joy in the teaching [dhamma + pīti + rasa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning flavour of delight in the Dhamma; juice of joy in the teaching
Construction dhamma + pīti + rasa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammapītiyā + rasa)
Sanskrit dharma + prīti + rasa

Example

pavivekarasaṃ pitvā,
rasaṃ upasamassa ca,
niddaro hoti nippāpo,
dhammapītirasaṃ pivaṃ.

DHP 205 sukhavaggo
dhammapuñjamatta

nt. mere heap of phenomena ✗

Meaning giving precedence to the teaching; lit. Dhamma in front

Commentary (VINa) pāḷiṃ vācento dhammapurekkhāro

dhammappakāsana

nt. illuminating the Dhamma ✗

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning connected with the Dhamma

Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhammena + paṭisaṃyutta)
dhammappaṭisaṃvedī

adj. experiencing mental phenomena; conscious of the thought ✗
dhammappamāṇa

adj. who measures by teaching; appraising by Dhamma; who judges on the basis of instruction [dhamma + pamāṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who measures by teaching; appraising by Dhamma; who judges on the basis of instruction
Construction dhamma + pamāṇa
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhammena + pamāṇa)
Commentary (ANa) dhamme pamāṇaṃ gahetvā pasanno dhammappamāṇo nāma … satasahassaṃ koṭṭhāse katvā pana eko koṭṭhāso'va dhammappamāṇo, sesā na dhammappamāṇā'ti veditabbā.
Sanskrit dharma + pramāṇa

Example

rūpappamāṇo rūpappasanno, ghosappamāṇo ghosappasanno, lūkhappamāṇo lūkhappasanno, dhammappamāṇo dhammappasanno. ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin'ti.

AN 4.65 rūpasuttaṃ
dhammappamodita

adj. delighted by the Dhamma; pleased by the teaching; (comm) cause for happiness [dhamma + pamodita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning delighted by the Dhamma; pleased by the teaching; (comm) cause for happiness
Construction dhamma + pamodita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhammena + pamodita)
Commentary (ANa) dhammappamoditānaṃ satan'ti ettha dhammo vuccati kāraṇaṃ, kenaci'd'eva kāraṇena pamuditānaṃ santānaṃ.
Sanskrit dharma + pramodita

Example

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, setughāto gīte, setughāto nacce, alaṃ vo dhammappamoditānaṃ sataṃ sitaṃ sitamattāyā'ti.

AN 3.108 ruṇṇasuttaṃ
dhammappasanna

adj. who has confidence in teaching; whose faith is based on Dhamma; pleased by instruction [dhamma + pasanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has confidence in teaching; whose faith is based on Dhamma; pleased by instruction
Construction dhamma + pasanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhammena + pasanna)
Sanskrit dharma + prasanna

Example

rūpappamāṇo rūpappasanno, ghosappamāṇo ghosappasanno, lūkhappamāṇo lūkhappasanno, dhammappamāṇo dhammappasanno. ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin'ti.

AN 4.65 rūpasuttaṃ
dhammabhaṇḍāgārika

masc. treasurer of the Dhamma; epithet of Ānanda [dhamma + bhaṇḍāgārika] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning treasurer of the Dhamma; epithet of Ānanda
Construction dhamma + bhaṇḍāgārika
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + bhaṇḍāgārika)
Commentary (DNt) tathā dhammabhaṇḍ'āgāro, tattha niyutto'ti dhammabhaṇḍ'āgāriko. atha vā nānārājabhaṇḍarakkhako bhaṇḍ'āgāriko viyā'ti bhaṇḍ'āgāriko, dhammassa anurakkhako bhaṇḍ'āgārikoti tam'eva sadisatākāraṇadassanena visesetvā dhammabhaṇḍ'āgāriko''ti vutto. (APt) dhammo pariyatti, so'va bhaṇḍaṃ dhanaṃ sukhadāyakato, tassa agāraṃ ṭhapan'aṭṭhānaṃ gehaṃ, tabbhāve tiṭṭhatī'ti dhammabhaṇḍ'āgāriko, iko.
Sanskrit dharma + bhāṇḍāgārika
dhammabhisamaya

masc. right understanding of dhamma ✗
dhammabhūta

adj. understanding the reality; lit. become the Dhamma [dhamma + bhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning understanding the reality; lit. become the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + bhūta
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + bhūta)
Commentary (MNa) aviparītasabhāv'aṭṭhena pariyattidhammappavattanato vā hadayena cintetvā vācāya nicchāritadhammamayo'ti dhammabhūto.
Sanskrit dharma + bhūta

Example

so h'āvuso, bhagavā jānaṃ jānāti, passaṃ passati, cakkhubhūto ñāṇabhūto dhammabhūto brahmabhūto, vattā pavattā, atthassa ninnetā, amatassa dātā, dhammassāmī tathāgato

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ
dhammabheri

fem. drum of the Dhamma ✗
dhammabhoga

masc. value of the teaching; richness of the Dhamma; wealth of the teaching [dhamma + bhoga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning value of the teaching; richness of the Dhamma; wealth of the teaching
Construction dhamma + bhoga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + bhoga)
Antonym āmisabhoga
Commentary (SNa) dhammojaṃ dhammabhogan'ti ubhayen'api dhammaparibhogo'va kathito. (ANa) catunnaṃ paccayānaṃ bhuñjanaṃ āmisabhogo, dhammassa bhuñjanaṃ dhammabhogo.
Sanskrit dharma + bhoga

Example

taṃ mayaṃ āyasmato sāriputtassa dhamm'ojaṃ dhammabhogaṃ dhamm'ānuggahaṃ anussarāmā'ti.

SN 47.13 cundasuttaṃ
dhammamakkhāsi

aor. explained the teaching; clarified the Dhamma ✗
dhammamacchariya

nt. stinginess about the Dhamma [dhamma + macchariya] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning stinginess about the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + macchariya
dhammamaccharī

adj. stingy with (sharing) the teaching; selfish about (teaching) Dhamma [dhamma + maccharī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning stingy with (sharing) the teaching; selfish about (teaching) Dhamma
Construction dhamma + maccharī
Commentary (ANa) dhammamaccharinī'ti pariyattidhammaṃ maccharāyati, aññesaṃ dātuṃ na icchati.
dhammamaññāya

ger. understanding the Dhamma; comprehending the teaching [dhammaṃ + aññāya] ✓

Grammar ger of dhammaṃ ājānāti, comp vb
Meaning understanding the Dhamma; comprehending the teaching
Construction dhammaṃ + aññāya
Sanskrit dharma + ājñāya

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo khippanisantī ca hoti kusalesu dhammesu, sutānañ'ca dhammānaṃ dhārakajātiko hoti, dhātānañ'ca dhammānaṃ atth'ūpaparikkhī hoti attham'aññāya dhammam'aññāya, dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipanno hoti.

AN 4.97 khippanisantisuttaṃ

kusalī bhāsasī tesaṃ,
mārapāsappahāyinaṃ,
kassa te dhammam'aññāya,
acchiduṃ bhavabandhanan'ti.

SN 1.50 ghaṭīkārasuttaṃ
dhammamadesesi

aor. taught the Dhamma; preached the Dhamma [dhammaṃ + adesesi] ✓

Grammar aor, comp vb
Meaning taught the Dhamma; preached the Dhamma
Construction dhammaṃ + adesesi
Commentary (NIDD2) dhammam'adesesī'ti dhamman'ti ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ … nibbānañ'ca nibbānagāminiñ'ca paṭipadaṃ ācikkhi desesi paññapesi paṭṭhapesi vivari vibhaji uttānīakāsi pakāsesī'ti, yo te dhammam'adesesi.
Sanskrit dharma + adikṣat, adīdiśat

Example

buddho dhammam'adesesi,
jātiyā samatikkamaṃ,
sabbadukkhappahānāya,
so maṃ sacce nivesayi.

SN 5.6 cālāsuttaṃ
dhammamanusāsati

pr. teaches the Dhamma; explains the teaching [dhammaṃ + anusāsati] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning teaches the Dhamma; explains the teaching
Construction dhammaṃ + anusāsati
Compound comp verb (dhammaṃ + anusāsati)
Commentary (SNa) yo dhammam'anusāsatī'ti yo dhammaṃ anusāsati, aṭṭhakathaṃ katheti, pāḷiṃ vāceti, pucchitapañhaṃ vissajjeti, kammaṭṭhānaṃ ācikkhati, dhammassavanaṃ karoti, sabbo'p'esa dhammaṃ anusāsati nāma.
Sanskrit dharmam + anuśāsati

Example

so ca sabbadado hoti,
yo dadāti upassayaṃ,
amataṃ dado ca so hoti,
yo dhammam'anusāsatī'ti.

SN 1.42 kiṃdadasuttaṃ
dhammamabhiññāya

ger. directly knowing the teaching; understanding reality experientially [dhamma + abhiññāya] ✓

Grammar ger, comp vb
Meaning directly knowing the teaching; understanding reality experientially
Construction dhamma + abhiññāya
Commentary (ITIa) dhammamabhiññāyā'ti catusaccadhammaṃ abhiññāya aññāya ñātatīraṇapariññāhi yath'ārahaṃ pubbabhāge jānitvā.
Sanskrit dharma + abhijñā, abhijñīya

Example

yo ca dhammam'abhiññāya,
dhammam'aññāya paṇḍito,
rahado'va nivāte ca,
anejo vūpasammati.

ITI 92 saṅghāṭikaṇṇasuttaṃ
dhammamaya 1

adj. made of the Dhamma [dhamma + maya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning made of the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + maya
Sanskrit dharmamaya

Example

sele yathā pabbatamuddhaniṭṭhito,
yathā'pi passe janataṃ samantato,
tath'ūpamaṃ dhammamayaṃ sumedho,
pāsādam'āruyha samantacakkhu,
sok'āvatiṇṇaṃ janatam'apetasoko,
avekkhati jātijar'ābhibhūtan'ti.

ITI 38 vitakkasuttaṃ
dhammamaya 2

adj. made of mental phenomena; consisting of thought [dhamma + maya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning made of mental phenomena; consisting of thought
Construction dhamma + maya
Sanskrit dharmamaya
dhammamaya 3

adj. virtuous; righteous ✗
dhammamārabbha

ind. concerning the teaching; about the Dhamma [dhammam + ārabbha] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning concerning the teaching; about the Dhamma
Construction dhammam + ārabbha
dhammamuttamaṃ

sandhi. supreme teaching; highest Dhamma; ultimate reality; ultimate nature of things [dhammaṃ + uttamaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + adj
Meaning supreme teaching; highest Dhamma; ultimate reality; ultimate nature of things
Construction dhammaṃ + uttamaṃ
Sanskrit dharma + uttama

Examples

yo ca vassasataṃ jīve,
apassaṃ dhammam'uttamaṃ,
ek'āhaṃ jīvitaṃ seyyo,
passato dhammam'uttamaṃ.

DHP 115 sahassavaggo

tañ'c'āhaṃ abhinandāmi,
mahesi dhammam'uttamaṃ,
yaṃ viditvā sato caraṃ,
tare loke visattikaṃ.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
dhammameva

sandhi. only the Dhamma; just the Dhamma [dhamma + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + ind
Meaning only the Dhamma; just the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + eva
Sanskrit dharma + eva

Example

anuyogo ca kho, sadukkho eso dhammo saupaghāto saupāyāso sapariḷāho, micchāpaṭipadā'ti, iti vadaṃ dhammam'eva deseti.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
dhammayāga

masc. Dhamma offering; Dhamma sacrifice [dhamma + yāga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning Dhamma offering; Dhamma sacrifice
Construction dhamma + yāga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + yāga)
Commentary (ITIa) mahāsamayasutta-maṅgalasutta-cūḷarāhul'ovādasutta-samacittasutta-desan'ādayo dhammayāgā
Sanskrit dharma + yāga

Example

yo dhammayāgaṃ ayajī amaccharī,
tathāgato sabbabhūt'ānukampī,
taṃ t'ādisaṃ devamanussaseṭṭhaṃ,
sattā namassanti bhavassa pāragun'ti.

ITI 100 brāhmaṇadhammayāgasuttaṃ
dhammayāgī

adj. (one) who offers dhamma ✗
dhammayāna

nt. vehicle of Dhamma; carriage of reality [dhamma + yāna] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning vehicle of Dhamma; carriage of reality
Construction dhamma + yāna
Commentary (SNa) dhammabhūtattā yānattā ca dhammayānaṃ iti'pi
dhammayutta

adj. Dhamma-related; connected with the teaching [dhamma + yutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning Dhamma-related; connected with the teaching
Construction dhamma + yutta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhammena + yutta)
Commentary (THa) dhammayuttan'ti ... dhamm'ūpasaṃhitaṃ
Sanskrit dharma + yukta

Example

cirassaṃ vata me mahito mahesī,
mahāvanaṃ samaṇo paccapādi,
so'haṃ cajissāmi sahassapāpaṃ,
sutvāna gāthaṃ tava dhammayuttaṃ.

TH 255 aṅgulimālattheragāthā
dhammayoga

adj. devoted to the teaching [dhamma + yoga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoted to the teaching
Construction dhamma + yoga
Compound sattamī tappurisa (dhamme + yoga)
Sanskrit dharma + yoga

Example

idh'āvuso, dhammayogā bhikkhū jhāyī bhikkhū apasādenti, ime pana jhāyino'mhā, jhāyino'mhā'ti jhāyanti pajjhāyanti nijjhāyanti avajjhāyanti

AN 6.46 mahācundasuttaṃ
dhammarakkhita 1

Meaning protected by a religion
Construction dhamma + rakkhita

Sanskrit dharma + rakṣita

Example

yā tā māturakkhitā piturakkhitā mātāpiturakkhitā bhāturakkhitā bhaginirakkhitā ñātirakkhitā gottarakkhitā dhammarakkhitā sasāmikā saparidaṇḍā antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittā'pi

dhammarakkhita 2

Meaning generic monk's name used in vinaya examples; lit. protected by the Dhamma

Synonym buddharakkhita, saṅgharakkhita, tissa
Sanskrit dharma + rakṣita
dhammarata 1

adj. lover of the teaching; devoted to the Dhamma [dhamma + rata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning lover of the teaching; devoted to the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + rata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (dhamme + rata)
Sanskrit dharma + rata

Example

dhamm'ārāmo dhammarato,
dhammaṃ anuvicintayaṃ,
dhammaṃ anussaraṃ bhikkhu,
saddhammā na parihāyati.

DHP 364 bhikkhuvaggo
dhammarata 2

adj. taking pleasure in mental phenomena; pleased by thinking [dhamma + rata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning taking pleasure in mental phenomena; pleased by thinking
Construction dhamma + rata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (dhammesu + rata)
Sanskrit dharma + rata

Example

mano kho, māgaṇḍiya, dhamm'ārāmo dhammarato dhammasammudito. so tathāgatassa danto gutto rakkhito saṃvuto, tassa ca saṃvarāya dhammaṃ deseti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
dhammaratana

nt. treasure of the teaching [dhamma + ratana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning treasure of the teaching
Construction dhamma + ratana
Antonym āmisaratana
Commentary (ANa) ratikaraṇ'aṭṭhena āmisaṃ āmisaratanaṃ, dhammo dhammaratanaṃ.
Sanskrit dharma + ratna

Example

imāni kho, bhikkhave, dve ratanāni. etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ ratanānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammaratanan'ti.

AN 2.10 vassūpanāyikasuttaṃ
dhammarati

fem. delight in the Dhamma; love for the Dhamma [dhamma + rati] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning delight in the Dhamma; love for the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + rati
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + rati)
Sanskrit dharma + rati

Example

sabbadānaṃ dhammadānaṃ jināti,
sabbarasaṃ dhammaraso jināti,
sabbaratiṃ dhammarati jināti,
taṇhakkhayo sabbadukkhaṃ jināti.

DHP 354 taṇhāvaggo
dhammarasa

masc. taste of the Dhamma; flavour of the Dhamma [dhamma + rasa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning taste of the Dhamma; flavour of the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + rasa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + rasa)
