sabbadānaṃ dhammadānaṃ jināti,
sabbarasaṃ dhammaraso jināti,
sabbaratiṃ dhammarati jināti,
taṇhakkhayo sabbadukkhaṃ jināti.

DHP 354 taṇhāvaggo
dhammarāga 1

masc. passion for the teaching; love for the Dhamma [dhamma + rāga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning passion for the teaching; love for the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + rāga
Compound sattamī tappurisa (dhamme + rāga)
Commentary (MNa) dhammarāgena dhammanandiyā'ti padadvayehi samathavipassanāsu chandarāgo vutto.
Sanskrit dharma + rāga

Example

no ce āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpuṇāti, ten'eva dhammarāgena tāya dhammanandiyā pañcannaṃ oram'bhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.

AN 9.36 jhānasuttaṃ
dhammarāga 2

adj. greed for mental phenomena; desire for thoughts [dhamma + rāga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning greed for mental phenomena; desire for thoughts
Construction dhamma + rāga
Sanskrit dharma + rāga

Example

puna caparaṃ, upavāṇa, bhikkhu manasā dhammaṃ viññāya dhammappaṭisaṃvedī ca hoti dhammarāgappaṭisaṃvedī ca.

SN 35.70 upavāṇasandiṭṭhikasuttaṃ
dhammarāgappaṭisaṃvedī

adj. experiencing greed for the mental phenomena; experiencing desire for the thoughts ✗
dhammarāja 1

masc. just king; righteous ruler; benign dictator [dhamma + rāja] ✓

Grammar masc, atta group, comp
Meaning just king; righteous ruler; benign dictator
Construction dhamma + rāja
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + rāja)
Commentary (ANa) dhammarājā'ti tass'eva vevacanaṃ. dhammena vā laddharajjattā dhammarājā.
Sanskrit dharmarāja

Examples

sace agāraṃ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato. tass'imāni satta ratanāni bhavanti

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

khat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. upahat'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā. sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā pitaraṃ dhammikaṃ dhammarājānaṃ jīvitā na voropessatha, imasmiññ'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ uppajjissathā'ti.

DN 2.32 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ
dhammarāja 2

masc. king of the Dhamma; epithet of the Buddha [dhamma + rāja] ✓

Grammar masc, atta group, comp
Meaning king of the Dhamma; epithet of the Buddha
Construction dhamma + rāja
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + rāja)
Sanskrit dharmarāja

Example

idañ'hi taṃ jetavanaṃ,
isisaṅghanisevitaṃ,
āvutthaṃ dhammarājena,
pītisañjananaṃ mama.

SN 1.48 jetavanasuttaṃ
dhammarājāsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.133 (AN5.133) ✗
dhammaladdha

adj. justly acquired; honestly gained; legally obtained; legitimately acquired [dhamma + laddha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning justly acquired; honestly gained; legally obtained; legitimately acquired
Construction dhamma + laddha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhammena + laddha)
Commentary (SNa) dhammaladdhassā'ti dhammena samena laddhassa bhogassa dhammaladdhassa ca puggalassa.
Sanskrit dharma + labhda

Examples

yo dhammaladdhassa dadāti dānaṃ,
uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatassa jantu,
atikkamma so vetaraṇiṃ yamassa,
dibbāni ṭhānāni upeti macco'ti.

SN 1.33 sādhusuttaṃ

kodhanassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa kodh'ābhibhūtassa kodhaparetassa, ye'pi'ssa te honti bhogā uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā, te'pi rājāno rājakosaṃ pavesenti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
dhammalābha

masc. acquiring mental phenomena; obtaining thoughts [dhamma + lābha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning acquiring mental phenomena; obtaining thoughts
Construction dhamma + lābha
dhammavagga

masc. Chapter 9 of Dukanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 2.88-98 ✗
dhammavara

masc. excellent teaching; sublime doctrine [dhamma + vara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning excellent teaching; sublime doctrine
Construction dhamma + vara
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + vara)
Sanskrit dharma + vara

Examples

vanappagumbe yatha phussit'agge,
gimhānamāse paṭhamasmiṃ gimhe,
tath'ūpamaṃ dhammavaraṃ adesayi,
nibbānagāmiṃ paramaṃ hitāya,
idam'pi buddhe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1

varo varaññū varado var'āharo,
anuttaro dhammavaraṃ adesayi,
idam'pi buddhe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1
dhammavavatthāna

nt. defining mental phenomena [dhamma + vavatthāna] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning defining mental phenomena
Construction dhamma + vavatthāna
dhammavādī 1

adj. who speaks about Dhamma; who speaks according to the teaching [dhamma + vādī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who speaks about Dhamma; who speaks according to the teaching
Construction dhamma + vādī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammaṃ + vādī)
Commentary (MNa) navalokuttaradhammasannissitaṃ katvā vadatī'ti dhammavādī
Sanskrit dharma + vādin

Examples

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, lokena vivadāmi, loko'va mayā vivadati. na, bhikkhave, dhammavādī kenaci lokasmiṃ vivadati.

SN 22.94 pupphasuttaṃ

kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī nidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti kālena sāpadesaṃ pariyantavatiṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
dhammavādī 2

adj. who speaks the truth ✗
dhammavādīpañhāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 38.3 (SN38.3) ✗
dhammavicaya

masc. investigation of reality; examining states; analysing the teaching [dhamma + vicaya] ✓

Grammar masc, in comps, comp
Meaning investigation of reality; examining states; analysing the teaching
Construction dhamma + vicaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + vicaya)
Sanskrit dharma + vicaya

Examples

santaṃ vā ajjhattaṃ dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgaṃ, atthi me ajjhattaṃ dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgo'ti pajānāti

DN 22.13 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

yasmiñ'ca kho, bhikkhave, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, kālo tasmiṃ samaye dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, kālo vīriyasambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, kālo pītisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
dhammavicayasambojjhaṅga

masc. investigation of reality as an element of awakening; analysing the teaching as an factor of enlightenment [dhammavicaya + sambojjhaṅga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning investigation of reality as an element of awakening; analysing the teaching as an factor of enlightenment
Construction dhammavicaya + sambojjhaṅga
Compound kammadhāraya (dhammavicaya + sambojjhaṅga)
Sanskrit dharma + vicaya + sambodhyaṅga

Examples

yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathā sato viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ paññāya pavicinati pavicarati parivīmaṃsam'āpajjati, dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti.

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ

yasmiñ'ca kho, bhikkhave, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, kālo tasmiṃ samaye dhammavicayasambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, kālo vīriyasambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya, kālo pītisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
dhammavicāra

masc. pondering about mental phenomena; contemplating things [dhamma + vicāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning pondering about mental phenomena; contemplating things
Construction dhamma + vicāra
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhamme + vicāra)
Sanskrit dharma + vicāra

Example

rūpavicāro loke ... saddavicāro loke ... gandhavicāro loke ... rasavicāro loke ... phoṭṭhabbavicāro loke ... dhammavicāro loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ, etth'esā taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati, ettha nivisamānā nivisati. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, dukkhasamudayaṃ ariyasaccaṃ.

MN 10 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
dhammavitakka

masc. thoughts about the Dhamma; thinking about the teaching [dhamma + vitakka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning thoughts about the Dhamma; thinking about the teaching
Construction dhamma + vitakka
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + vitakka)
Sanskrit dharma + vitarka

Examples

tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate ath'āparaṃ dhammavitakka-avasissati. so hoti samādhi na c'eva santo na ca paṇīto nappaṭippassaddhaladdho na ekodibhāv'ādhigato sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato hoti.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ

rūpavitakko loke ... saddavitakko loke ... gandhavitakko loke ... rasavitakko loke ... phoṭṭhabbavitakko loke ... dhammavitakko loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ, etth'esā taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati, ettha nivisamānā nivisati.

MN 10 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
dhammavitakkāvasissati

pr. thoughts about the Dhamma are left; contemplation of the teaching remains; (comm) imperfections of insight remain [dhammavitakkā + avasissati] ~

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning thoughts about the Dhamma are left; contemplation of the teaching remains; (comm) imperfections of insight remain
Construction dhammavitakkā + avasissati
Variant dhammavitakkovasissati
Commentary (ANa) dhammavitakk'āvasissantī'ti dhammavitakkā nāma dasavipassan'upakkilesavitakkā.
dhammavitakkovasissati

pr. thoughts about the Dhamma are left; contemplation of the teaching remains; (comm) imperfections of insight remain [dhammavitakko + avasissati] ~

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning thoughts about the Dhamma are left; contemplation of the teaching remains; (comm) imperfections of insight remain
Construction dhammavitakko + avasissati
Variant dhammavitakkāvasissati
Commentary (ANa) dhammavitakk'āvasissantī'ti dhammavitakkā nāma dasavipassan'upakkilesavitakkā.
dhammavidū

adj. who understands the Dhamma ✗
dhammavinaya

masc. teaching and training; doctrine and discipline [dhamma + vinaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning teaching and training; doctrine and discipline
Construction dhamma + vinaya
Compound dvanda (dhamma ca vinaya ca)
Commentary (SNa) imaṃ dhammavinayan'ti imaṃ dhammañ'ca vinayañ'ca. ubhayam'p'etaṃ sāsanass'eva nāmaṃ.
Sanskrit dharma + vinaya

Examples

evam'evaṃ kho pahārāda imasmiṃ dhammavinaye anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā na āyataken'eva aññāpaṭivedho

AN 8.19 pahārādasuttaṃ

evaṃ adhiccam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ manussattaṃ labhati. evaṃ adhiccam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ tathāgato loke uppajjati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho. evaṃ adhiccam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ tathāgatappavedito dhammavinayo loke dibbati.

SN 56.48 dutiyachiggaḷayugasuttaṃ
dhammavinicchaya

masc. discrimination of mental phenomena; evaluation of mental processes; investigation of reality [dhamma + vinicchaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning discrimination of mental phenomena; evaluation of mental processes; investigation of reality
Construction dhamma + vinicchaya
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + vinicchaya)
Sanskrit dharma + viniścaya

Example

asso yathā bhadro kasāniviṭṭho,
ātāpino saṃvegino bhavātha,
saddhāya sīlena ca vīriyena ca,
samādhinā dhammavinicchayena ca,
sampannavijjācaraṇā patissatā,
jahissatha dukkham'idaṃ anappakaṃ.

DHP 144 daṇḍavaggo
dhammavinīta

adj. trained in the Dhamma; guided in the teaching [dhamma + vinīta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning trained in the Dhamma; guided in the teaching
Construction dhamma + vinīta
dhammavipariṇāmavirāganirodha

masc. change, fading and ending of mental phenomena; alteration, disappearance and cessation of thoughts [dhamma + vipariṇāmavirāganirodha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning change, fading and ending of mental phenomena; alteration, disappearance and cessation of thoughts
Construction dhamma + vipariṇāmavirāganirodha
dhammavipassanā

fem. insight into phenomena [dhamma + vipassanā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, in comps
Meaning insight into phenomena
Construction dhamma + vipassanā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (dhammesu + vipassanā)
Sanskrit dharma + vipaśyanā

Example

idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo lābhī c'eva hoti ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassa lābhī ca adhipaññādhammavipassanāya.

AN 4.94 tatiyasamādhisuttaṃ
dhammavihārī

adj. who practices the teaching; who lives according to the Dhamma [dhamma + vihārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who practices the teaching; who lives according to the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + vihārī
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + vihārī)
Sanskrit dharma + vihārin

Examples

so tāya dhammapariyattiyā na divasaṃ atināmeti, n'āpi riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, anuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ. evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bhikkhu dhammavihārī hoti.

AN 5.73 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ

iti kho, bhikkhu, desito mayā pariyattibahulo, desito paññattibahulo, desito sajjhāyabahulo, desito vitakkabahulo, desito dhammavihārī.

AN 5.73 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ
dhammavuddhi

fem. growth in the teaching [dhamma + vuddhi] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning growth in the teaching
Construction dhamma + vuddhi
Antonym āmisavuddhi
Commentary (ANa) āmisena vaḍḍhanaṃ āmisavuddhi, dhammena vaḍḍhanaṃ dhammavuddhi.
dhammaveda

masc. inspiration from the teaching; enthusiasm from the Dhamma [dhamma + veda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning inspiration from the teaching; enthusiasm from the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + veda
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (dhammasmā + veda)
Commentary (MNa) dhammavedan'ti aveccappasādassa hetuṃ odhiso kilesappahānaṃ paccavekkhato uppannaṃ vuttappakārameva vedanti evampi ettha attho veditabbo. (ANa) dhammavedan'ti pāḷiṃ nissāya uppannaṃ pītipāmojjaṃ.
Sanskrit dharma + veda

Examples

yathodhi kho pan'assa cattaṃ hoti vantaṃ muttaṃ pahīnaṃ paṭinissaṭṭhaṃ, so buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgatomhī'ti labhati atthavedaṃ, labhati dhammavedaṃ, labhati dhamm'ūpasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṃ, labhati dhammavedaṃ, labhati dhamm'ūpasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ.

AN 6.10 mahānāmasuttaṃ
dhammavepulla

nt. expansion of the teaching [dhamma + vepulla] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning expansion of the teaching
Construction dhamma + vepulla
Antonym āmisavepulla
Commentary (ANa) āmisassa vipulabhāvo āmisavepullaṃ, dhammassa vipulabhāvo dhammavepullan'ti.
dhammavevacana

nt. synonym for the Dhamma [dhamma + vevacana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning synonym for the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + vevacana
Commentary (VINa) buddhavevacanāni vā'ti buddhassa vā pariyāyanāmāni ... asakyaputtiyassa vā. tattha vaṇṇapaṭṭhāne āgataṃ nāmasahassaṃ upāligāthāsu (ma ni 2.76) nāmasataṃ aññāni ca guṇato labbhamānāni nāmāni buddhavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. sabbāni'pi dhammassa nāmāni dhammavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. esa nayo sabbattha.
dhammasaṅkappa

masc. thought about mental phenomena; conception of thoughts [dhamma + saṅkappa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning thought about mental phenomena; conception of thoughts
Construction dhamma + saṅkappa
dhammasaṅgaṇī

fem. Book 1 of the Abhidhamma; Enumeration of Phenomena [dhamma + saṅgaṇī] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning Book 1 of the Abhidhamma; Enumeration of Phenomena
Construction dhamma + saṅgaṇī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammānaṃ + saṅgaṇī)
Sanskrit dharma + saṃgaṇanā
dhammasaṅgaha

masc. support with teaching [dhamma + saṅgaha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning support with teaching
Construction dhamma + saṅgaha
dhammasaṅgāhaka

masc. compiler of the scriptures ✗
dhammasaṅgīti

fem. recital of sacred scriptures, Buddhist council ✗
dhammasañcetanā

fem. thoughts about mental phenomena; intention regarding thoughts [dhamma + sañcetanā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning thoughts about mental phenomena; intention regarding thoughts
Construction dhamma + sañcetanā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (dhammesu + sañcetanā)
Sanskrit dharma + saṃcetanā

Example

katame ca, bhikkhave, saṅkhārā? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, cetanākāyā, rūpasañcetanā, saddasañcetanā, gandhasañcetanā, rasasañcetanā, phoṭṭhabbasañcetanā, dhammasañcetanā.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
dhammasaññā

fem. recognition of mental activity; perception of mental phenomena [dhamma + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning recognition of mental activity; perception of mental phenomena
Construction dhamma + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammānaṃ + saññā)
Sanskrit dharma + saṃjñā

Examples

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave ... se āyatane veditabbe yattha mano ca nirujjhati, dhammasaññā ca nirujjhati, se āyatane veditabbe'ti. idaṃ vatvā bhagavā uṭṭhāy'āsanā vihāraṃ pāvisi.

SN 35.117 kāmaguṇasuttaṃ

kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? cha'y'imā, bhikkhave, saññā, rūpasaññā, saddasaññā, gandhasaññā, rasasaññā, phoṭṭhabbasaññā, dhammasaññā.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ
dhammasaññī

adj. (+loc) perceiving (something) as the teaching [dhamma + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (something) as the teaching
Construction dhamma + saññī
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + saññī)
Sanskrit dharma + saṃjñin

Example

dve'me, bhikkhave, bālā. katame dve? yo ca adhamme dhammasaññī, yo ca dhamme adhammasaññī. ime kho, bhikkhave, dve bālā'ti.

AN 2.105 bālavaggo
dhammasadda

masc. the word "dhamma" [dhamma + sadda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning the word "dhamma"
Construction dhamma + sadda
dhammasanthāra

masc. hospitality with the teaching [dhamma + santhāra] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning hospitality with the teaching
Construction dhamma + santhāra
Antonym āmisasanthāra
Synonym dhammapaṭisanthāra
Commentary (ANa) catūhi paccayehi attano ca parassa ca antarapaṭicchādanavasena santharaṇaṃ āmisasanthāro, dhammena santharaṇaṃ dhammasanthāro.
dhammasandosa

masc. corruption of the teaching [dhamma + sandosa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning corruption of the teaching
Construction dhamma + sandosa
Commentary (ANa) dhammasandosā vinayasandoso'ti dhammasandosena vinayasandoso hoti. kathaṃ pana dhammasmiṃ dussante vinayo dussati nāma? samathavipassanādhammesu gabbhaṃ aggaṇhantesu pañcavidho vinayo na hoti, evaṃ dhamme dussante vinayo dussati. dussīlassa pana saṃvaravinayo nāma na hoti, tasmiṃ asati samathavipassanā gabbhaṃ na gaṇhāti. evaṃ vinayasandosen'api dhammasandoso veditabbo.
Sanskrit dharma + saṃdoṣa (bsk)
dhammasannicaya

masc. accumulation of the teaching [dhamma + sannicaya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning accumulation of the teaching
Construction dhamma + sannicaya
Antonym āmisasannicaya
Commentary (ANa) āmisassa cinanaṃ vaḍḍhanaṃ āmisasannicayo, dhammassa cinanaṃ vaḍḍhanaṃ dhammasannicayo.

Meaning Dhamma Hall; community hall
Construction dhamma + sabhā

Meaning inherent characteristic; natural condition
Construction dhamma + sabhāva
dhammasamannesanā

fem. (+loc) investigation of the character (of); examination of the qualities (of) [dhamma + samannesanā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, comp (+loc)
Meaning investigation of the character (of); examination of the qualities (of)
Construction dhamma + samannesanā
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammaṃ + samannesanā)
Commentary (MNa) dhammasamannesanā'ti sabhāvasamannesanā.
Sanskrit dharma + samanveṣaṇa

Example

evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tathāgate dhammasamannesanā hoti. evañ'ca pana tathāgato dhammatāsusamanniṭṭho hotī'ti.

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ
dhammasamaya

masc. Dhamma gathering; Dhamma council [dhamma + samaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning Dhamma gathering; Dhamma council
Construction dhamma + samaya
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + samaya)
Commentary (SNa) āgat'amha imaṃ dhammasamayan'ti evaṃ samāgate devakāye disvā mayam'pi imaṃ dhammasamūhaṃ āgatā.
Sanskrit dharma + samaya

Example

mahāsamayo pavanasmiṃ,
devakāyā samāgatā,
āgat'amha imaṃ dhammasamayaṃ,
dakkhitāye aparājitasaṅghan'ti.

SN 1.37 samayasuttaṃ
dhammasamādāna

nt. undertaking a practice; taking up something [dhamma + samādāna] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning undertaking a practice; taking up something
Construction dhamma + samādāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + samādāna)
Commentary (MNa) dhammasamādānānī'ti dhammo'ti gahitagahaṇāni.
Sanskrit dharma + samādāna

Example

atthi, bhikkhave, dhammasamādānaṃ paccuppannasukhaṃ āyatiṃ dukkhavipākaṃ, atthi, bhikkhave, dhammasamādānaṃ paccuppannadukkhañ'c'eva āyatiñ'ca dukkhavipākaṃ

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
dhammasamādhi

masc. mental composure based on natural principles [dhamma + samādhi] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mental composure based on natural principles
Construction dhamma + samādhi
Commentary (SNa) dhammasamādhī'ti dasakusalakammapatha-dhammā, cittasamādhī'ti saha vipassanāya cattāro maggā.
dhammasamuppāda

masc. arising of phenomena; origination of causes [dhamma + samuppāda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning arising of phenomena; origination of causes
Construction dhamma + samuppāda
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammānaṃ + samuppāda)
Sanskrit dharma + samutpāda

Example

suddhaṃ dhammasamuppādaṃ,
suddhaṃ saṅkhārasantatiṃ,
passantassa yathābhūtaṃ,
na bhayaṃ hoti gāmaṇi.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

adj. generated by mental phenomena; produced by thought [dhamma + sambhava] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning generated by mental phenomena; produced by thought
Construction dhamma + sambhava
dhammasambhoga

masc. partaking of the teaching together; mutual enjoyment of Dhamma; lit. eating Dhamma together [dhamma + sambhoga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning partaking of the teaching together; mutual enjoyment of Dhamma; lit. eating Dhamma together
Construction dhamma + sambhoga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + sambhoga)
Commentary (VIN 2.5.7.9) dhammasambhogo nāma uddisati vā uddisāpeti vā, padena uddisati vā uddisāpeti vā, pade pade āpatti pācittiyassa. akkharāya uddisati vā uddisāpeti vā, akkhar'akkharāya āpatti pācittiyassa.
Sanskrit dharma + sambhoga

Example

sambhuñjeyya vā'ti sambhogo nāma dve sambhogā, āmisasambhogo ca dhammasambhogo ca.

VIN 2.5.7.9 ukkhittasambhogasikkhāpadaṃ
dhammasammata

adj. considered to be moral; regarded as natural [dhamma + sammata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning considered to be moral; regarded as natural

dhammasammudita

adj. pleased with mental phenomena; enjoying thinking [dhamma + sammudita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning pleased with mental phenomena; enjoying thinking
Construction dhamma + sammudita
Compound sattamī tappurisa (dhammesu + sammudita)
Sanskrit dharma + sumudita

Example

kāyo kho, māgaṇḍiya, phoṭṭhabb'ārāmo phoṭṭhabbarato ... mano kho, māgaṇḍiya, dhamm'ārāmo dhammarato dhammasammudito. so tathāgatassa danto gutto rakkhito saṃvuto, tassa ca saṃvarāya dhammaṃ deseti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

TH 107 dhammasavattheragāthā

nt. hearing of the Dhamma ✗

dhammasaṃvibhāga

masc. sharing the Dhamma [dhamma + saṃvibhāga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning sharing the Dhamma

Sanskrit dharma + saṃvibhāga

Example

dve'me, bhikkhave, saṃvibhāgā āmisasaṃvibhāgo ca dhammasaṃvibhāgo ca. etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ saṃvibhāgānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammasaṃvibhāgo.

ITI 100 brāhmaṇadhammayāgasuttaṃ
dhammasaṃhita

adj. connected with Dhamma; related to the teaching; connected with reality [dhamma + saṃhita] ✓

Meaning connected with Dhamma; related to the teaching; connected with reality
Construction dhamma + saṃhita

Sanskrit dharma + saṃhita

Example

na h'etaṃ, poṭṭhapāda, atthasaṃhitaṃ na dhammasaṃhitaṃ n'ādibrahmacariyakaṃ, na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṃvattati

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā

Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + sākacchā)

Examples

AN 4.147 dutiyakālasuttaṃ

khantī ca sovacassatā, samaṇānañ'ca dassanaṃ.
kālena dhammasākacchā, etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.

SNP 16 maṅgalasuttaṃ
cūḷavaggo 4
dhammasāmī

masc. master of the Dhamma; lord of the teaching; epithet of the Buddha [dhamma + sāmī] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning master of the Dhamma; lord of the teaching; epithet of the Buddha
Construction dhamma + sāmī
dhammasāra

masc. essence of the Dhamma; the core of the teaching [dhamma + sāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning essence of the Dhamma; the core of the teaching
Construction dhamma + sāra
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + sāra)
Sanskrit dharma + sāra

Example

ye etadaññāya padaṃ asaṅkhataṃ,
vimuttacittā bhavanettisaṅkhayā,
te dhammasār'ādhigamā khaye ratā,
pahaṃsu te sabbabhavāni tādino'ti.

ITI 44 nibbānadhātusuttaṃ
dhammasārādhigama

masc. realizing the essence of the Dhamma; reaching the core the teaching [dhamma + sāra + adhigama] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning realizing the essence of the Dhamma; reaching the core the teaching
Construction dhamma + sāra + adhigama
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammasāraṃ + dhigama)
Commentary (ITIa) dhammasār'ādhigamā'ti vimuttisārattā imassa dhammavinayassa, dhammesu sārabhūtassa arahattassa adhigamanato.
Sanskrit dharma + sāra + adhigama

Example

ye etadaññāya padaṃ asaṅkhataṃ,
vimuttacittā bhavanettisaṅkhayā,
te dhammasār'ādhigamā khaye ratā,
pahaṃsu te sabbabhavāni tādino'ti.

dhammasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.182 (AN10.182) ✗

fem. excellence of the teaching; excellent nature of the Dhamma [dhamma + sudhammatā] ✓

masc. stream of the Dhamma [dhamma + sota] ✓

ayaṃ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotaṃ samāpanno sīl'ānussatiṃ bhāveti.

ayaṃ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotasamāpanno buddh'ānussatiṃ bhāveti.

AN 11.11 paṭhamamahānāmasuttaṃ
dhammassavana

nt. hearing the teaching; hearing a sermon; listening to the Dhamma [dhamma + savana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning hearing the teaching; hearing a sermon; listening to the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + savana
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammaṃ + savana)
Sanskrit dharmaśravaṇa

Examples

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā dhammassavane. katame pañca? assutaṃ suṇāti, sutaṃ pariyodāpeti, kaṅkhaṃ vitarati, diṭṭhiṃ ujuṃ karoti, cittam'assa pasīdati.

AN 5.202 dhammassavanasuttaṃ

ekasmiñ'hi kāle satthari āḷavinagaraṃ upanissāya aggāḷave cetiye viharante bahū upāsakā upāsikā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ca vihāraṃ dhammassavan'atthāya gacchanti, divā dhammassavanaṃ hoti.

JAa 16 tipallatthamigajātakavaṇṇanā
dhammassavanagga

nt. hall where the Dhamma is preached [dhammassavana + agga] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning hall where the Dhamma is preached
Construction dhammassavana + agga
dhammassavanattha

masc. sake of hearing a sermon; purpose of hearing the teaching [dhammassavana + attha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning sake of hearing a sermon; purpose of hearing the teaching
Construction dhammassavana + attha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassavanassa + attha)
Sanskrit dharmaśravaṇa + artha

Examples

tesu ariyasāvakānaṃ dve'y'eva kiccāni ahesuṃ. purebhattaṃ dānaṃ denti, pacchābhattaṃ gandhamāl'ādihatthā vatthabhesajjapānak'ādīni gāhāpetvā dhammassavan'atthāya gacchanti.

DHPa 1.1.1 cakkhupālattheravatthu

ekasmiñ'hi kāle satthari āḷavinagaraṃ upanissāya aggāḷave cetiye viharante bahū upāsakā upāsikā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ca vihāraṃ dhammassavan'atthāya gacchanti, divā dhammassavanaṃ hoti.

JAa 16 tipallatthamigajātakavaṇṇanā
dhammassavanasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.202 (AN5.202) ✗
dhammassānudhamma

adj. in accordance with the teaching; following the teaching; in line with the teaching [dhammassa + anudhamma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning in accordance with the teaching; following the teaching; in line with the teaching
Construction dhammassa + anudhamma
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + anudhamma)
Synonym dhammānudhamma
Sanskrit dharma + anu + dharma

Examples

paṇḍito, bhikkhave, pukkusāti kulaputto paccapādi dhammass'ānudhammaṃ, na ca maṃ dhamm'ādhikaraṇaṃ vihesesi.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

tassa kā gati, ko abhisamparāyo'ti? paṇḍito, bhikkhave, bāhiyo dārucīriyo paccapādi dhammass'ānudhammaṃ, na ca maṃ dhamm'ādhikaraṇaṃ vihesesi. parinibbuto, bhikkhave, bāhiyo dārucīriyo'ti.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ
dhammassāmī

masc. lord of the Dhamma; master of reality [dhamma + sāmī] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning lord of the Dhamma; master of reality
Construction dhamma + sāmī
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + sāmī)
Sanskrit dharma + svāmin

Example

so h'āvuso, bhagavā jānaṃ jānāti, passaṃ passati, cakkhubhūto ñāṇabhūto dhammabhūto brahmabhūto, vattā pavattā, atthassa ninnetā, amatassa dātā, dhammassāmī tathāgato

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ
dhammaṃ ājānāti

idiom. understands the Dhamma; comprehends the teaching ✗
dhammaṃ carati

idiom. practices the teaching; lives the Dhamma ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + pr
Meaning practices the teaching; lives the Dhamma
Commentary (SNa) dhammaṃ care'ti dasakusalakammapathadhammaṃ carati.
Sanskrit dharmam + carati

Examples

uttiṭṭhe nappamajjeyya,
dhammaṃ sucaritaṃ care,
dhammacārī sukhaṃ seti,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca.

DHP 168 lokavaggo

dhammaṃ care yo'pi samuñjakaṃ care,
dārañ'ca posaṃ dadam'appakasmiṃ,
sataṃ sahassānaṃ sahassayāginaṃ,
kalam'pi n'āgghanti tathāvidhassa te'ti.

SN 1.32 maccharisuttaṃ
dhammaṃ deseti

idiom. preaches the Dhamma ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + pr
Meaning preaches the Dhamma
Sanskrit dharmam + deśayati

Examples

so ārāmagato parisati dhammaṃ deseti, na taṃ parisaṃ ussādeti, na taṃ parisaṃ apasādeti, añña'd'atthu dhammiyā kathāya taṃ parisaṃ sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṃseti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

accāraddhamhi vīriyamhi,
satthā loke anuttaro,
vīṇ'opamaṃ karitvā me,
dhammaṃ desesi cakkhumā,
tass'āhaṃ vacanaṃ sutvā,
vihāsiṃ sāsane rato.

TH 243 soṇakoḷivisattheragāthā
dhammaṃ bhāsati

idiom. preaches the Dhamma; gives a Dhamma talk ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + pr
Meaning preaches the Dhamma; gives a Dhamma talk

Examples

so saṅkhāya kulāni upasaṅkamati saṅkhāya nisīdati saṅkhāya dhammaṃ bhāsati saṅkhāya uccārapassāvaṃ sandhāreti

AN 4.157 rogasuttaṃ

saṅghagato kho pana anānākathiko hoti atiracchānakathiko. sāmaṃ vā dhammaṃ bhāsati, paraṃ vā ajjhesati, ariyaṃ vā tuṇhībhāvaṃ n'ātimaññati.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ
dhammātitheyya

nt. gift of the teaching to a guest [dhamma + ātitheyya] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning gift of the teaching to a guest
Construction dhamma + ātitheyya
Antonym āmisātitheyya
dhammātherīgāthā

fem. Therīgāthā 17 (THI17) ✗
dhammādāsa

masc. mirror of the Dhamma ✗
dhammādāsadhammapariyāya

masc. Dhamma discourse on the mirror of the Dhamma ✗
dhammādhammena

ind. legitimately and illegitimately; lawfully and unlawfully; legally and illegally [dhamma + adhamma + ena] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning legitimately and illegitimately; lawfully and unlawfully; legally and illegally
Construction dhamma + adhamma + ena
dhammādhamma + ena
Commentary (SNa) dhamm'ādhammenā'ti dhammena ca adhammena ca. (ANa) dhamm'ādhammenā'ti dasakusalakammapatha-dhammena'pi dasaakusalakammapatha-adhammena'pi.
dhammādhikaraṇa

nt. controversy about the teaching; technical points about the teaching [dhamma + adhikaraṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning controversy about the teaching; technical points about the teaching
Construction dhamma + adhikaraṇa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + adhikaraṇa)
Commentary (MNa) na ca maṃ dhammādhikaraṇaṃ vihesesī'ti mañ'ca dhammakāraṇā na kilamesi, na punappunaṃ kathāpesī'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit dharma + adhikaraṇa

Examples

tassa kā gati, ko abhisamparāyo'ti? paṇḍito, bhikkhave, bāhiyo dārucīriyo paccapādi dhammass'ānudhammaṃ, na ca maṃ dhamm'ādhikaraṇaṃ vihesesi. parinibbuto, bhikkhave, bāhiyo dārucīriyo'ti.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

paṇḍito, bhikkhave, pukkusāti kulaputto paccapādi dhammass'ānudhammaṃ, na ca maṃ dhamm'ādhikaraṇaṃ vihesesi.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
dhammādhiṭṭhāna

adj. with respect to the teaching; relevant to the Dhamma [dhamma + adhiṭṭhāna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with respect to the teaching; relevant to the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + adhiṭṭhāna
Commentary (NPa) dhammavasen'eva desitaṃ dhamm'ādhiṭṭhānaṃ.
Sanskrit dharma + adhiṣṭhāna
dhammādhipa

adj. taking the Dhamma as an authority; putting the teaching in charge [dhamma + adhipa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning taking the Dhamma as an authority; putting the teaching in charge
Construction dhamma + adhipa
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + adhipa)
Commentary (ANa) dhamm'ādhipo'ti dhammajeṭṭhako.
Sanskrit dharma + adhipa

Example

passanti devā ca tathāgatā ca,
lokasmiṃ bālaṃ visamaṃ carantaṃ,
tasmā hi att'ādhipateyyako ca,
lok'ādhipo ca nipako ca jhāyī,
dhamm'ādhipo ca anudhammacārī,
na hīyati saccaparakkamo muni.

AN 3.40 ādhipateyyasuttaṃ
dhammādhipati

adj. respecting of Dhamma as one's guide ✗
dhammādhipateyya 1

nt. fact of taking Dhamma as an authority; putting the teaching in charge [dhamma + ādhipateyya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning fact of taking Dhamma as an authority; putting the teaching in charge
Construction dhamma + ādhipateyya
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + ādhipateyya)
Commentary (ANa) navavidhaṃ lokuttaradhammaṃ jeṭṭhakaṃ katvā nibbattitaṃ dhamm'ādhipateyyaṃ.
Sanskrit dharma + ādhipatya

Examples

tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, ādhipateyyāni. katamāni tīṇi? att'ādhipateyyaṃ, lok'ādhipateyyaṃ, dhamm'ādhipateyyaṃ.

AN 3.40 ādhipateyyasuttaṃ

so dhammaṃ'y'eva adhipatiṃ karitvā akusalaṃ pajahati, kusalaṃ bhāveti, sāvajjaṃ pajahati, anavajjaṃ bhāveti, suddhaṃ attānaṃ pariharati. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, dhamm'ādhipateyyaṃ.

AN 3.40 ādhipateyyasuttaṃ
dhammādhipateyya 2

adj. with Dhamma as one's authority [dhamma + ādhipateyya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with Dhamma as one's authority
Construction dhamma + ādhipateyya
dhammādhipatteyya 1

adj. with dhamma as controlling influence ✗
dhammādhipatteyya 2

nt. control by dhamma ✗
dhammādhibhū

masc. master of thought [dhamma + adhibhū] ~

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning master of thought
Construction dhamma + adhibhū
dhammādhibhūta

adj. overpowered by mental phenomena; overwhelmed by thoughts [dhamma + adhibhūta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning overpowered by mental phenomena; overwhelmed by thoughts
Construction dhamma + adhibhūta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhammehi + adhibhūta)
dhammānādariya

nt. disrespect towards the Dhamma; contempt for the teaching [dhamma + anādariya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning disrespect towards the Dhamma; contempt for the teaching
Construction dhamma + anādariya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (dhammassa + anādariya)
Commentary (VIN 2.5.6.4) dhamm'ānādariyaṃ nāma upasampannena paññattena vuccamāno kath'āyaṃ nasseyya vā vinasseyya vā antaradhāyeyya vā, taṃ vā na sikkhitu'kāmo anādariyaṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
Sanskrit dharma + anādaraṇa

Example

anādariyaṃ nāma dve anādariyāni, puggal'ānādariyañ'ca dhamm'ānādariyañ'ca.

VIN 2.5.6.4 anādariyasikkhāpadaṃ
dhammāniccatā

fem. impermanence of mental phenomena [dhamma + aniccatā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning impermanence of mental phenomena
Construction dhamma + aniccatā

fem. concern about teaching; compassion with regard to the teaching [dhamma + anukampā] ~

Meaning concern about teaching; compassion with regard to the teaching

Commentary (SNa) dhamm'ānuggahan'ti dhammena anuggahaṇaṃ.
Sanskrit dharma + anugraha

Examples

taṃ mayaṃ āyasmato sāriputtassa dhamm'ojaṃ dhammabhogaṃ dhamm'ānuggahaṃ anussarāmā'ti.

SN 47.13 cundasuttaṃ

dve'me, bhikkhave, anuggahā āmis'ānuggaho ca dhamm'ānuggaho ca. etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ anuggahānaṃ yadidaṃ dhamm'ānuggaho.

ITI 100 brāhmaṇadhammayāgasuttaṃ
dhammānudhamma

adj. in accordance with the teaching; following the teaching; lit. Dhamma according to the Dhamma [dhamma + anudhamma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning in accordance with the teaching; following the teaching; lit. Dhamma according to the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + anudhamma
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + anudhamma)
Synonym dhammassānudhamma
Commentary (MNa) dhamm'ānudhamman'ti dhammassa anudhammaṃ anucchavikaṃ paṭipadaṃ.
Sanskrit dharma + anu + dharma

Examples

yo kho, ānanda, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā upāsako vā upāsikā vā dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipanno viharati sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī so tathāgataṃ sakkaroti garuṃ karoti māneti pūjeti apaciyati paramāya pūjāya

DN 16.27 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

yato kho tvaṃ, māgaṇḍiya, sappurise bhajissasi tato tvaṃ, māgaṇḍiya, saddhammaṃ sossasi. yato kho tvaṃ, māgaṇḍiya, saddhammaṃ sossasi tato tvaṃ, māgaṇḍiya, dhamm'ānudhammaṃ paṭipajjissasi.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
dhammānudhammapaṭipanna

adj. practicing in accordance with the teaching; following the Dhamma accordingly [dhammānudhamma + paṭipanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning practicing in accordance with the teaching; following the Dhamma accordingly
Construction dhammānudhamma + paṭipanna
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammānudhammaṃ + paṭipanna)
Commentary (ITIa) sattame dhamm'ānudhammapaṭipannassā'ti ettha dhammo nāma navavidho lok'uttaradhammo, tassa dhammassa anudhammo sīlavisuddhiādi pubbabhāgapaṭipadādhammo, taṃ dhamm'ānudhammaṃ paṭipannassa adhigantuṃ paṭipajjamānassa.
Sanskrit dharma + anu + dharma + pratipanna

Example

dhamm'ānudhammapaṭipannassa bhikkhuno ayam'anudhammo hoti veyyākaraṇāya, dhamm'ānudhammapaṭipanno'yan'ti bhāsamāno dhammaññ'eva bhāsati no adhammaṃ, vitakkayamāno vā dhammavitakkaññ'eva vitakketi no adhammavitakkaṃ, tadubhayaṃ vā pana abhinivejjetvā upekkhako viharati sato sampajāno'ti.

ITI 86 dhammānudhammapaṭipannasuttaṃ
dhammānudhammapaṭipannasutta

nt. Itivuttaka 86 (ITI 86) ✗
dhammānudhammappaṭipatti

fem. practice of the teaching according to the teaching; accordant following of the Dhamma [dhamma + anudhamma + paṭipatti] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning practice of the teaching according to the teaching; accordant following of the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + anudhamma + paṭipatti
dhammānudhammappaṭipanna

adj. practising correctly; following the teaching properly; practising the Dhamma properly; lit. practising the Dhamma according to the Dhamma [dhamma + anudhamma + paṭipanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning practising correctly; following the teaching properly; practising the Dhamma properly; lit. practising the Dhamma according to the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + anudhamma + paṭipanna
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammānudhammaṃ + paṭipanna)
Commentary (ANa) dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipannā'ti ariyadhammassa anudhammabhūtaṃ vipassanādhammaṃ paṭipannā. (ANa) dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipanno'ti navalokuttaradhammassa anudhammaṃ saha sīlena pubbabhāgapaṭipadaṃ paṭipanno.
Sanskrit dharma + anu + dharma + pratipanna

Examples

catuppadāya ce'pi, bhikkhu, gāthāya attham'aññāya dhammam'aññāya dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipanno hoti bahussuto dhammadharo'ti alaṃ vacanāyā'ti.

AN 4.186 ummaggasuttaṃ

na tāv'āhaṃ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhuniyo na sāvikā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipannā

DN 16.20 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ
dhammānudhammappaṭippanna

adj. practising the teaching according to the teaching; following the Dhamma accordingly [dhamma + anudhamma + paṭippanna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning practising the teaching according to the teaching; following the Dhamma accordingly
Construction dhamma + anudhamma + paṭippanna
dhammānupassanā

fem. contemplating of phenomena; observing of mental phenomena [dhamma + anupassanā] ~

Grammar fem, act, comp
Meaning contemplating of phenomena; observing of mental phenomena
Construction dhamma + anupassanā
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhamme + anupassanā)
dhammānupassī

adj. observing phenomena; who watches mental phenomena [dhamma + anupassī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning observing phenomena; who watches mental phenomena
Construction dhamma + anupassī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammaṃ + anupassī)
Sanskrit dharma + anupaśyin

Examples

kathañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhamm'ānupassī viharati pañcasu nīvaraṇesu

DN 22.10 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anicc'ānupassī assasissāmī'ti sikkhati ... dhammesu dhamm'ānupassī, bhikkhave, tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ
dhammānupassīsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.118 (AN6.118) ✗
dhammānubhāva

masc. majestic power of the Dhamma [dhamma + ānubhāva] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning majestic power of the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + ānubhāva

Example

bhavatu sabbamaṅgalaṃ,
rakkhantu sabbadevatā,
sabbadhamm'ānubhāvena,
sadā sotthi bhavantu te

Trad Chanting
dhammānuvattī

adj. following the Dhamma; acting according to the teaching [dhamma + anuvattī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning following the Dhamma; acting according to the teaching
Construction dhamma + anuvattī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammaṃ + anuvattī)
Sanskrit dharma + anuvartin

Example

ye ca kho samma'd'akkhāte,
dhamme dhamm'ānuvattino,
te janā pāram'essanti,
maccudheyyaṃ suduttaraṃ.

DHP 86 paṇḍitavaggo
dhammānusārī 1

masc. Dhamma follower; adherent of the teaching [dhamma + anusārī] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning Dhamma follower; adherent of the teaching
Construction dhamma + anusārī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhammaṃ + anusārī)
Antonym saddhānusārī
Commentary (MNa) dhamm'ānusārino, saddh'ānusārino'ti ime dve paṭhamamaggasamaṅgino.
Sanskrit dharma + anusārin

Examples

yassa kho, bhikkhave, ime dhammā evaṃ paññāya mattaso nijjhānaṃ khamanti, ayaṃ vuccati dhamm'ānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṃ, sappurisabhūmiṃ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṃ

SN 25.1 cakkhusuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, ye te bhikkhū dhamm'ānusārino saddh'ānusārino, te'pi tiriyaṃ mārassa sotaṃ chetvā sotthinā pāraṃ gamissanti.

MN 34 cūḷagopālakasuttaṃ
dhammānusārī 2

masc. acting in conformity with the Dhamma ✗
dhammānussati

fem. recollection of (the qualities of) the teaching [dhamma + anussati] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning recollection of (the qualities of) the teaching
Construction dhamma + anussati
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + anussati)
Sanskrit dharma + anusmṛti

Example

ayaṃ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotaṃ samāpanno dhamm'ānussatiṃ bhāveti

AN 6.10 mahānāmasuttaṃ
dhammābhisamaya

masc. understanding of the Dhamma ✗
dhammāmata

nt. nectar of the Dhamma ✗
dhammāyatana

nt. field of mental phenomena; realm of qualia [dhamma + āyatana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning field of mental phenomena; realm of qualia
Construction dhamma + āyatana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammānaṃ + āyatana)

Example

cha bāhirāni āyatanāni veditabbānī'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? rūp'āyatanaṃ sadd'āyatanaṃ gandh'āyatanaṃ ras'āyatanaṃ phoṭṭhabb'āyatanaṃ dhamm'āyatanaṃ

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
dhammārammaṇa

adj. based on mental phenomena; related to thought processes [dhamma + ārammaṇa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning based on mental phenomena; related to thought processes
Construction dhamma + ārammaṇa
dhammārāma 1

adj. enjoying the Dhamma; taking pleasure in the Dhamma; fond of the teaching [dhamma + ārāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enjoying the Dhamma; taking pleasure in the Dhamma; fond of the teaching
Construction dhamma + ārāma
Compound sattamī tappurisa (dhamme + ārāma)
Sanskrit dharma + ārāma

Example

dhamm'ārāmo dhammarato,
dhammaṃ anuvicintayaṃ,
dhammaṃ anussaraṃ bhikkhu,
saddhammā na parihāyati.

DHP 364 bhikkhuvaggo
dhammārāma 2

adj. enjoying mental phenomena; taking pleasure thought [dhamma + ārāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enjoying mental phenomena; taking pleasure thought
Construction dhamma + ārāma
Compound sattamī tappurisa (dhammesu + ārāma)
Sanskrit dharma + ārāma

Example

kāyo kho, māgaṇḍiya, phoṭṭhabb'ārāmo phoṭṭhabbarato ... mano kho, māgaṇḍiya, dhamm'ārāmo dhammarato dhammasammudito. so tathāgatassa danto gutto rakkhito saṃvuto, tassa ca saṃvarāya dhammaṃ deseti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
dhammāsana

nt. Dhamma seat; preacher’s seat [dhamma + āsana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Dhamma seat; preacher’s seat
Construction dhamma + āsana
Compound kammadhāraya (dhamma + āsana)
Sanskrit dharmāsana

Example

so pana dhamm'āsanato otaranto dhammakathiko viya, nisseṇito otaranto puriso viya, ca dve ca hatthe dve ca pāde pasāretvā ṭhitako'va mātukucchisambhavena kenaci asucinā amakkhito suddho visado kāsikavatthe nikkhittamaṇiratanaṃ viya jotayanto mātukucchito nikkhami.

JAa 1.N.2 avidūre nidānakathā
dhammika 1

adj. legal; legitimate; lawful; lit. according to the Dhamma [√dhar + ma + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from dhamma
Meaning legal; legitimate; lawful; lit. according to the Dhamma
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma + ika
dhamma + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Phonetic Change r > m
Antonym adhammika
Synonym sahadhammika
Commentary (VIN 2.5.8.9) dhammikānan'ti dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena katattā dhammā etesu atthī'ti dhammikāni, tesaṃ dhammikānaṃ catunnaṃ saṅghakammānaṃ.
Sanskrit dharmya
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu dhammikānaṃ kammānaṃ chandaṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 79 kammappaṭibāhanasikkhāpadaṃ

katamañ'ca, gahapati, atthisukhaṃ? idha, gahapati, kulaputtassa bhogā honti uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā.

AN 4.62 ānaṇyasuttaṃ
dhammika 2

adj. righteous; just; lit. according to the Dhamma [√dhar + ma + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from dhamma
Meaning righteous; just; lit. according to the Dhamma
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma + ika
dhamma + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Phonetic Change r > m
Antonym adhammika
Synonym dhammaṭṭha, sugatī
Sanskrit dharmya
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

sace agāraṃ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato. tass'imāni satta ratanāni bhavanti

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

na attahetu na parassa hetu,
na puttam'icche na dhanaṃ na raṭṭhaṃ,
na iccheyya adhammena samiddhim'attano,
sa sīlavā paññavā dhammiko siyā.

DHP 84 paṇḍitavaggo
dhammika 3

adj. correct; proper; the right kind (of); lit. according to the Dhamma [√dhar + ma + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from dhamma
Meaning correct; proper; the right kind (of); lit. according to the Dhamma
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma + ika
dhamma + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Phonetic Change r > m
Antonym adhammika
Synonym yutta, sāmīcika
Sanskrit dharmya
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Example

atha kho bhagavā saccakaṃ nigaṇṭhaputtaṃ etadavoca, yā'pi kho te esā, aggivessana, purimā kāyabhāvanā bhāsitā sā'pi ariyassa vinaye no dhammikā kāyabhāvanā.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
dhammikattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 195 (TH195) ✗
dhammikavagga

masc. Chapter 5 of Chakkanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.43-54 ✗
dhammikasañña

adj. (+loc) perceiving (something) as legitimate [dhammika + sañña] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (something) as legitimate
Construction dhammika + sañña
dhammikasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.54 (AN6.54) ✗
dhammikasutta 2

nt. Sutta Nipāta 2.14 (SNP 26) ✗
dhammiddhi

fem. success in the teaching [dhamma + iddhi] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning success in the teaching
Construction dhamma + iddhi
Antonym āmisiddhi
Commentary (ANa) āmisaṃ ijjhanakasamijjhanakavasena āmisiddhi, dhammo'pi ijjhanakasamijjhanakavasena dhammiddhi.
dhammiya

adj. righteous; religious; moral; related to the Dhamma [√dhar + ma + iya] ✓

Grammar adj, from dhamma
Meaning righteous; religious; moral; related to the Dhamma
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma + iya
dhamma + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Phonetic Change r > m
Synonym dhammaṭṭha, dhammī
Sanskrit dharmya
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

tena kho pana samayena bhagavā bhikkhū nibbānapaṭisaṃyuttāya dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṃseti

UD 73 tatiya nibbāna paṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ

kathañ'hi no siyā, bhante! idān'āhaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya amatena abhisitto'ti.

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ
dhammiyamāna

prp. acting in accordance with dhamma, with the rule ✗
dhammiyā kathāya

idiom. with a Dhamma talk; with a religious talk; with a spiritual talk [dhammiyā + kathāya] ✓

Grammar idiom, adj + fem
Meaning with a Dhamma talk; with a religious talk; with a spiritual talk
Construction dhammiyā + kathāya
Variant dhammīkathā
Sanskrit dharmyayā + kathayā

Examples

so bhuttāvī anumodati, na taṃ bhattaṃ garahati, na aññaṃ bhattaṃ paṭikaṅkhati, añña'd'atthu dhammiyā kathāya taṃ parisaṃ sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṃseti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

kathañ'hi no siyā, bhante! idān'āhaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya amatena abhisitto'ti.

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ
dhammilla

masc. knot of hair, braided hair ✗
dhammī kathā

idiom. Dhamma talk; religious talk; spiritual discussion [dhammī + kathā] ✓

Grammar idiom, adj + fem
Meaning Dhamma talk; religious talk; spiritual discussion
Construction dhammī + kathā
Variant dhammīkathā
Sanskrit dharmin + kathā

Examples

alattha no ajja bhagavato sammukhā dhammiṃ kathaṃ savanāyā'ti?

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ

cirassutā no, āvuso ānanda, bhagavato sammukhā dhammī kathā. sādhu mayaṃ, āvuso ānanda, labheyyāma bhagavato sammukhā dhammiṃ kathaṃ savanāyā'ti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
dhammī 1

adj. righteous; religious; moral; related to the Dhamma [√dhar + ma + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from dhamma
Meaning righteous; religious; moral; related to the Dhamma
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma + ī
dhamma + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change r > m
Synonym dhammaṭṭha, dhammiya
Sanskrit dharmin
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

alattha no ajja bhagavato sammukhā dhammiṃ kathaṃ savanāyā'ti?

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ

cirassutā no, āvuso ānanda, bhagavato sammukhā dhammī kathā. sādhu mayaṃ, āvuso ānanda, labheyyāma bhagavato sammukhā dhammiṃ kathaṃ savanāyā'ti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
dhammī 2

adj. having the nature (of); characterized (by); marked (with); with the fundamental attribute (of) [√dhar + ma + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from dhamma
Meaning having the nature (of); characterized (by); marked (with); with the fundamental attribute (of)
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma + ī
dhamma + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change r > m
Commentary (SNa) uppādavayadhammino'ti uppādavayasabhāvā.
Sanskrit dharmin
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

na tvaṃ bāle pajānāsi,
yathā arahataṃ vaco,
aniccā sabbasaṅkhārā,
uppādavayadhammino,
uppajjitvā nirujjhanti,
tesaṃ vūpasamo sukho'ti.

SN 1.11 nandanasuttaṃ

byādhidhammā jarādhammā,
atho maraṇadhammino,
yathā dhammā tathā sattā,
jigucchanti puthujjanā.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
dhammī 3

masc. (logic) thing qualified [√dhar] ✗
dhammīkathā

fem. religious talk ✗
dhammuddesa

masc. summary of the teaching; teaching in brief [dhamma + uddesa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning summary of the teaching; teaching in brief
Construction dhamma + uddesa
dhammuddhacca

nt. agitation about whether a state is of the noble path or not ✗
dhammuddhaccaviggahita

adj. seized by agitation regarding the Dhamma; (comm) seized by agitation about the corruptions of insight [dhamma + uddhacca + viggahita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning seized by agitation regarding the Dhamma; (comm) seized by agitation about the corruptions of insight
Construction dhamma + uddhacca + viggahita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhammuddhaccena + viggahita)
Commentary (ANa) dhamm'uddhaccaviggahitan'ti samathavipassanādhammesu dasavipassan'upakkilesasaṅkhātena uddhaccena viggahitaṃ, suggahitan'ti attho.
Sanskrit dharma + auddhatya + vigṛhīta

Example

puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhuno dhamm'uddhaccaviggahitaṃ mānasaṃ hoti. hoti so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ taṃ cittaṃ ajjhattam'eva santiṭṭhati sannisīdati ekodi hoti samādhiyati. tassa maggo sañjāyati. so taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti.

AN 4.170 yuganaddhasuttaṃ
dhammuposatha

masc. Dhamma observance day [dhamma + uposatha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning Dhamma observance day
Construction dhamma + uposatha
Commentary (ANa) dhamm'uposathan'ti sahatantikaṃ navalokuttaradhammaṃ ārabbha upavutthattā ayaṃ uposatho dhamm'uposatho'ti vutto.
dhammūpanissaya

masc. support for the Dhamma or True Idea ✗
dhammūpasañhita

adj. connected with the teaching; concerning the Dhamma; for the Dhamma; (comm) connected with the Pāli text and the commentary [dhamma + upasañhita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning connected with the teaching; concerning the Dhamma; for the Dhamma; (comm) connected with the Pāli text and the commentary
Construction dhamma + upasañhita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhammena + upasañhita)
Variant dhammūpasaṃhita
Commentary (VINa) dhamm'ūpasañhito'ti pāḷinissito, ubhayenā'pi vivaṭṭ'ūpanissitam'eva vadati. (ANa) dhamm'ūpasañhitan'ti pāḷiñ'ca aṭṭhakathañ'ca nissāya uppannaṃ.
Sanskrit dharma + upasaṃhita

Examples

dhammo nāma buddhabhāsito, sāvakabhāsito, isibhāsito, devatābhāsito, atth'ūpasañhito, dhamm'ūpasañhito.

VIN 2.5.1.4 padasodhammasikkhāpadaṃ

ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṃ, labhati dhammavedaṃ, labhati dhamm'ūpasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ.

AN 6.10 mahānāmasuttaṃ
dhammūpasaṃhita

adj. connected with the teaching; concerning the Dhamma; for the Dhamma [dhamma + upasaṃhita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning connected with the teaching; concerning the Dhamma; for the Dhamma
Construction dhamma + upasaṃhita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (dhammena + upasaṃhita)
Variant dhammūpasañhita
Sanskrit dharma + upasaṃhita

Examples

ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṃ, labhati dhammavedaṃ, labhati dhamm'ūpasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ.

AN 6.10 mahānāmasuttaṃ

yathodhi kho pan'assa cattaṃ hoti vantaṃ muttaṃ pahīnaṃ paṭinissaṭṭhaṃ, so buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgatomhī'ti labhati atthavedaṃ, labhati dhammavedaṃ, labhati dhamm'ūpasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
dhammūpahāra

adj. presenting of ideas, images, or of the teachings ✗
dhammena 1

ind. righteously; ethically; religiously; morally; lit. with the law [√dhar + ma + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, instr sg of dhamma
Meaning righteously; ethically; religiously; morally; lit. with the law
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma + ena
dhamma + ena
Phonetic Change r > m
Antonym adhammena
Commentary (MNa) dhammenā'ti pāṇo na hantabbo'tiādinā pañcasīladhammena.
Sanskrit dharmeṇa
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

parosahassaṃ kho pan'assa puttā bhavanti sūrā vīr'aṅgarūpā parasenappamaddanā. so imaṃ pathaviṃ sāgarapariyantaṃ adaṇḍena asatthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

asāhasena dhammena,
samena nayatī pare,
dhammassa gutto medhāvī,
dhammaṭṭho'ti pavuccati.

DHP 257 dhammaṭṭhavaggo
dhammena 2

ind. lawfully; legally; lit. with the law [√dhar + ma + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, instr sg of dhamma
Meaning lawfully; legally; lit. with the law
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + ma + ena
dhamma + ena
Phonetic Change r > m
Antonym adhammena
Sanskrit dharmeṇa
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Example

yo vītarāgo vītarāgesu dadāti dānaṃ,
dhammena laddhaṃ supasannacitto,
abhisaddahaṃ kammaphalaṃ uḷāraṃ,
taṃ ve dānaṃ āmisadānānamaggan'ti.

MN 142 dakkhiṇāvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
dhammesa

sandhi. in things this [dhamme + esa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + pron
Meaning in things this
Construction dhamme + esa
Commentary (SNa) diṭṭhe dhamm'esa vipāko'ti tasmiṃ nibbattabhavane diṭṭhe dhamme esa vipāko.
Sanskrit dharmān + etaḥ

Example

parato āsīsare bālā,
tam'pi tesaṃ na labbhati,
diṭṭhe dhamm'esa vipāko,
samparāye ca duggatī'ti.

SN 1.49 maccharisuttaṃ
dhammesanā

fem. search for the teaching [dhamma + esanā] ~

Grammar fem, act, comp
Meaning search for the teaching
Construction dhamma + esanā
Antonym āmisesanā
Commentary (ANa) āmisassa esanā āmis'esanā, dhammassa esanā dhamm'esanā.
dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati

idiom. one remains among phenomena, closely observing the phenomena ~

Grammar idiom, masc + adj + pr
Meaning one remains among phenomena, closely observing the phenomena
Commentary (PM) [gha] kathaṃ dhammesu dhamm'ānupassī viharati? idh'ekacco ṭhapetvā kāyaṃ ṭhapetvā vedanaṃ ṭhapetvā cittaṃ tadavasese dhamme aniccato anupassati, no niccato, dukkhato anupassati, no sukhato, anattato anupassati, no attato, nibbindati, no nandati, virajjati, no rajjati, nirodheti, no samudeti, paṭinissajjati, no ādiyati. aniccato anupassanto niccasaññaṃ pajahati, dukkhato anupassanto sukhasaññaṃ pajahati, anattato anupassanto attasaññaṃ pajahati, nibbindanto nandiṃ pajahati, virajjanto rāgaṃ pajahati, nirodhento samudayaṃ pajahati, paṭinissajjanto ādānaṃ pajahati. imehi sattahi ākārehi te dhamme anupassati. dhammā upaṭṭhānaṃ, no sati.
dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ

idiom. among doctrines grasped after evaluation; in ideas adopted after consideration ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + ger + pp
Meaning among doctrines grasped after evaluation; in ideas adopted after consideration

Examples

yass'ūbhay'ante paṇidh'īdha n'atthi,
bhav'ābhavāya idha vā huraṃ vā,
nivesanā tassa na santi keci,
dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5

diṭṭhīnivesā na hi svātivattā,
dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ,
tasmā naro tesu nivesanesu,
nirassatī ādiyatī ca dhammaṃ.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3
dhammojas

masc. essence of the Dhamma; nourishing taste of the teaching; vitality of the Dhamma; Dhamma nectar [dhamma + ojas] ✓

Grammar masc, mano group, comp
Meaning essence of the Dhamma; nourishing taste of the teaching; vitality of the Dhamma; Dhamma nectar
Construction dhamma + ojas
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (dhammassa + ojas)
Commentary (SNa) dhammojaṃ dhammabhogan'ti ubhayen'api dhammaparibhogo'va kathito.
Notes mano-group nouns, while neuter in Sanskrit, are considered to be masculine by classical Pāḷi grammars such as Saddanīti
Sanskrit dharma + ojas

Example

taṃ mayaṃ āyasmato sāriputtassa dhamm'ojaṃ dhammabhogaṃ dhamm'ānuggahaṃ anussarāmā'ti.

SN 47.13 cundasuttaṃ
dhammosāraṇa

nt. investigation of states ✗
dhammketu

adj. with dhamma as one's banner ✗
dhammcudita

adj. (a monk) accused of an offence properly, by the rules ✗
dhara 1.1

adj. wearing [√dhar + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from dharati
Meaning wearing
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･8 *e (wear, hold, carry)
Construction √dhar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit dhara
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

paṃsukūladharaṃ jantuṃ,
kisaṃ dhamanisanthataṃ,
ekaṃ vanasmiṃ jhāyantaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 395 brāhmaṇavaggo

yassa kassaci, āvuso, bhikkhuno ime pāpakā akusalā icch'āvacarā appahīnā dissanti c'eva sūyanti ca, kiñ'cā'pi so hoti āraññiko pantasen'āsano piṇḍapātiko sapadānacārī paṃsukūliko lūkhacīvaradharo, atha kho naṃ sabrahmacārī na c'eva sakkaronti na garuṃ karonti na mānenti na pūjenti.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
dhara 1.2

adj. holding; carrying; bearing [√dhar + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from dharati
Meaning holding; carrying; bearing
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･8 *e (wear, hold, carry)
Construction √dhar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym dhāraya, dhārī, bhara, hattha, hāra, hārī
Sanskrit dhara
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Example

aham'asmi, bhikkhave, brāhmaṇo yācayogo sadā payatapāṇi antimadehadharo anuttaro bhisakko sallakatto.

ITI 100 brāhmaṇadhammayāgasuttaṃ
dhara 2.1

adj. remembering; keeping in mind; lit. carrying [√dhar + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from dharati
Meaning remembering; keeping in mind; lit. carrying
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit dhara

Examples

AN 7.6 vitthatadhanasuttaṃ

dullabho, bhikkhave, vuḍḍhapabbajito nipuṇo, dullabho ākappasampanno, dullabho bahussuto, dullabho dhammakathiko, dullabho vinayadharo.

dhava 1

masc. axle-wood tree; Anogeissus latifolia ✓

Meaning axle-wood tree; Anogeissus latifolia

Sanskrit dhava

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, sālo vā dhavo vā phandano vā tīhi māluvālatāhi uddhasto pariyonaddho anayaṃ āpajjati, byasanaṃ āpajjati, anayabyasanaṃ āpajjati.

dhava 2

masc. husband ✗
dhavajālikā

fem. name of a monastery; lit. with a net of axle-wood trees [dhava + jāla + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning name of a monastery; lit. with a net of axle-wood trees
Construction dhava + jāla + ikā
dhavajāla + ikā
Derivative taddhita (ikā)

Commentary (ANa) vaṭajālikāyan'ti evaṃnāmake vihāre. so kira vaṭavane niviṭṭhattā vaṭajālikā'ti saṅkhaṃ gato.
Sanskrit dhava + jālikā

Example

ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā uttaro mahisavatthusmiṃ viharati saṅkheyyake pabbate dhavajālikāyaṃ.

AN 8.8 uttaravipattisuttaṃ
dhavala 1

adj. white, clean ✗
dhavala 2

nt. white colour ✗
dhaṃsati

pr. (+abl) falls (from); falls down (from); is deprived (of) [√dhaṃs + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+abl)
Meaning falls (from); falls down (from); is deprived (of)
Root Family √dhaṃs
Root √dhaṃs･1 a (fall down, destroy)
√ In Comps dhaṃs or ddhaṃs
Base √dhaṃs + a > dhaṃsa
Construction dhaṃsa + ti
Synonym anupatati, padhaṃsati, papatati
Sanskrit dhvaṃsati
Sanskrit Root √dhvaṃs √dhvaṅs 1 (scatter)

Examples

yo'dha koci manussesu,
parapāṇāni hiṃsati,
asmā lokā paramhā ca,
ubhayā dhaṃsate naro.

TH 176 vāraṇattheragāthā

yo pubbe karaṇīyāni,
pacchā so kātum'icchati,
sukhā so dhaṃsate ṭhānā,
pacchā ca manutappati.

TH 172 bākulattheragāthā
dhaṃsate

pr. (+abl) one deprives oneself (from); one falls (from) [√dhaṃs + a + te] ✓

Grammar pr, reflx 3rd sg of dhaṃsati, intrans (+abl)
Meaning one deprives oneself (from); one falls (from)
Root Family √dhaṃs
Root √dhaṃs･1 a (fall down, destroy)
√ In Comps dhaṃs or ddhaṃs
Base √dhaṃs + a > dhaṃsa
Construction dhaṃsa + te
Sanskrit dhvaṃsate
Sanskrit Root √dhvaṃs √dhvaṅs 1 (scatter)

Examples

yo'dha koci manussesu,
parapāṇāni hiṃsati,
asmā lokā paramhā ca,
ubhayā dhaṃsate naro.

TH 176 vāraṇattheragāthā

yo pubbe karaṇīyāni,
pacchā so kātum'icchati,
sukhā so dhaṃsate ṭhānā,
pacchā ca manutappati.

TH 172 bākulattheragāthā
dhaṃsana

nt. ruining; destroying [√dhaṃs + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from dhaṃsati
Meaning ruining; destroying
Root Family √dhaṃs
Root √dhaṃs･1 a (fall down, destroy)
√ In Comps dhaṃs or ddhaṃs
Construction √dhaṃs + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym vināsana
Variant gandhana
Commentary (ITIa) yo hoti kulagandhano'ti kulacchedako kulavināsako. chedan'attho hi idha gandhasaddo, uppalagandhapaccatthikā'tiādīsu (pārā. 65) viya. keci pana kuladhaṃsano'ti paṭhan'ti, so ev'attho.
Sanskrit dhvaṃsana
Sanskrit Root √dhvaṃs √dhvaṅs 1 (scatter)
dhaṃsayati

pr. (+acc) causes the ruin of; destroys; brings down [√dhaṃs + *aya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, caus of dhaṃsati, trans (+acc)
Meaning causes the ruin of; destroys; brings down
Root Family √dhaṃs
Root √dhaṃs･1 *aya (fall down, destroy)
√ In Comps dhaṃs or ddhaṃs
Base √dhaṃs + aya > dhaṃsaya (caus)
Construction dhaṃsaya + ti
Sanskrit Root √dhvaṃs √dhvaṅs 1 (scatter)
dhaṃsita

pp. fallen (onto); destroyed [√dhaṃs + ita] ~

Grammar pp of dhaṃsati
Meaning fallen (onto); destroyed
Root Family √dhaṃs
Root √dhaṃs･1 a (fall down, destroy)
√ In Comps dhaṃs or ddhaṃs
Construction √dhaṃs + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Sanskrit dhvaṃsita
Sanskrit Root √dhvaṃs √dhvaṅs 1 (scatter)
dhaṃsī 1

adj. fallen; corrupt [√dhaṃs + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from dhaṃsati
Meaning fallen; corrupt
Root Family √dhaṃs
Root √dhaṃs･1 a (fall down, destroy)
√ In Comps dhaṃs or ddhaṃs
Construction √dhaṃs + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Sanskrit dhvaṃsin
Sanskrit Root √dhvaṃs √dhvaṅs 1 (scatter)

Example

sujīvaṃ ahirikena,
kākasūrena dhaṃsinā,
pakkhandinā pagabbhena,
saṃkiliṭṭhena jīvitaṃ.

DHP 244 malavaggo
dhaṃsī 2

adj. removing; abolishing; destroying [√dhaṃs + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from dhaṃsati
Meaning removing; abolishing; destroying
Root Family √dhaṃs
Root √dhaṃs･1 a (fall down, destroy)
√ In Comps dhaṃs or ddhaṃs
Construction √dhaṃs + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Synonym viddhaṃsaka
Sanskrit dhvaṃsin
Sanskrit Root √dhvaṃs √dhvaṅs 1 (scatter)

Example

gandhatelappadittena,
dīpena tamadhaṃsinā,
tilokadīpaṃ sambuddhaṃ,
pūjayāmi tamonudaṃ.

buddhavandana pūjāgāthā
dhaṃsī 3

adj. mistaken; wrong; at fault [√dhaṃs + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from dhaṃsati
Meaning mistaken; wrong; at fault
Root Family √dhaṃs
Root √dhaṃs･1 a (fall down, destroy)
√ In Comps dhaṃs or ddhaṃs
Construction √dhaṃs + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Synonym sāvajja
Commentary (MNa) dhaṃsī'ti guṇadhaṃsakā.
Sanskrit dhvaṃsin
Sanskrit Root √dhvaṃs √dhvaṅs 1 (scatter)

Example

mayam'eva, bho gotama, dhaṃsī, mayaṃ pagabbā, ye mayaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ vādena vādaṃ āsādetabbaṃ amaññimha. siyā hi, bho gotama, hatthiṃ pabhinnaṃ āsajja purisassa sotthibhāvo, na tv'eva bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ āsajja siyā purisassa sotthibhāvo.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
dhaṃsu

root. (gram) √dhaṃs (fall down, destroy) [√dhaṃs + u] ~

Construction √dhaṃs + u

pr. dares to attack; offends [√dhaṃs] ✗

MN 35 cūḷa saccakasuttaṃ

anekehi sambhārehi samāraddhā vadatī'ti. so taṃ vīṇaṃ dasadhā vā satadhā vā phāleyya, dasadhā vā satadhā vā taṃ phāletvā sakalikaṃ sakalikaṃ kareyya.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ
dhā 2

root. (gram) √dhā (support, nourish) [√dhā + ā] ✓

Sanskrit dhā
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Examples

502, 493. yamhi dā dhā mā ṭhā hā pā maha math'ādīnam'ī.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 502

yamhi paccaye pare dā dhā mā ṭhā hā pā maha matha icc'evam'ādīnaṃ dhātūnaṃ anto īkāram'āpajjate. dīyati, dhīyati, mīyati, ṭhīyati, hīyati, pīyati, mahīyati, mathīyati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 502
dhāta 1.1

pp. remembered; retained in mind; known off by heart [√dhar + *e + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of dhāreti
Meaning remembered; retained in mind; known off by heart
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･8 *e (wear, hold, carry)
Base √dhar + *e > dhāre
Construction dhāre + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > t
Synonym dhārita
Variant dhata
Commentary (ANa) dhātā'ti dhātā paguṇā. ekaccassa hi uggahitabuddhavacanaṃ dhātaṃ paguṇaṃ niccalikaṃ na hoti, asukaṃ suttaṃ vā jātakaṃ vā kathehī'ti vutte, sajjhāyitvā saṃsanditvā samanuggāhitvā jānissāmī'ti vadati. ekaccassa dhātaṃ paguṇaṃ bhav'aṅgasotasadisaṃ hoti, asukaṃ suttaṃ vā jātakaṃ vā kathehī'ti vutte uddharitvā tam'eva katheti. taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ dhātā'ti.
Sanskrit dhṛta
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo khippanisantī ca hoti kusalesu dhammesu, sutānañ'ca dhammānaṃ dhārakajātiko hoti, dhātānañ'ca dhammānaṃ atth'ūpaparikkhī hoti attham'aññāya dhammam'aññāya, dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipanno hoti.

AN 4.97 khippanisantisuttaṃ

tathārūpā'ssa dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manas'ānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, sutadhanaṃ

AN 7.6 vitthatadhanasuttaṃ
dhāta 2.1

pp. (of food) satisfied; lit. sucked, drunk [√dhe + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of √dhe
Meaning (of food) satisfied; lit. sucked, drunk
Root Family √dhe
Root √dhe×1 a (drink, suck)
Construction √dhe > dhā + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change e > ā
Antonym chāta
Synonym āraddhacitta
Sanskrit dhīta
Sanskrit Root √dhe √dhā 1 (suck)

Examples

atisītan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atiuṇhan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atisāyan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atipāto'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atichāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atidhāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti.

DN 31.11 siṅgālasuttaṃ

atidhāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti. tassa evaṃ kicc'āpadesabahulassa viharato anuppannā c'eva bhogā n'uppajjanti, uppannā ca bhogā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.

DN 31.11 siṅgālasuttaṃ
dhātar 1

masc. humour of the body, faculty of senses [√dhar] ✗
dhātar 2

masc. supporter; bearer, carrier; upholder; lit. who causes to carry [√dhar + *e + tar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from dhāreti
Meaning supporter; bearer, carrier; upholder; lit. who causes to carry
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･8 *e (wear, hold, carry)
Base √dhar + *e > dhāre
Construction dhāre + tar
Derivative kita (tar)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant dhatā
Notes memorizer, upholder
Sanskrit dhātṛ
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Example

āhuneyyo me'si hit'ānukampī,
dhātā vidhātā c'asi kāmapālo,
tayī hutā rāja mahapphalā hi,
kāmena me ummadantiṃ paṭiccha.

JA 527 ummādantījātakaṃ
dhātārammaṇa

adj. based on the element; with that state as the support; lit. element support [dhātu + ārammaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning based on the element; with that state as the support; lit. element support
Construction dhātu + ārammaṇa
Compound sattamī tappurisa (dhātuyā + ārammaṇaṃ)
Commentary (MNa) dhātārammaṇamevā'ti dhātusaṅkhātam'eva ārammaṇaṃ.
Sanskrit dhātu + ālambana

Example

so phasso anicco'ti passati, vedanā aniccā'ti passati, saññā aniccā'ti passati, saṅkhārā aniccā'ti passati, viññāṇaṃ aniccan'ti passati. tassa dhāt'ārammaṇam'eva cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati adhimuccati.

Meaning detailed analysis of states
Construction dhātu + vibhaṅga
dhātuvibhaṅgasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 140 (MN140) ✗
dhātuvibhāga

masc. separation of elements, distribution of relics ✗
dhātuvivaṇṇapetavatthu

nt. Petavatthu 35 (PV 35) ✗
dhātuvematta

nt. distinction in elements [dhātu + vematta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning distinction in elements
Construction dhātu + vematta
dhātuvemattadassana

nt. seeing a difference in elements [dhātuvematta + dassana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning seeing a difference in elements
Construction dhātuvematta + dassana
dhātusaṃyutta

nt. Chapter 14 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya; Connected Discourses on Elements [dhātu + saṃyutta] ~

Meaning Chapter 14 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya; Connected Discourses on Elements
Construction dhātu + saṃyutta
dhātusutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 18.9 (SN18.9) ✗
dhātusutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 26.9 (SN26.9) ✗
dhātusutta 3

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 27.9 (SN27.9) ✗
dhātusutta 4

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.111 (AN6.111) ✗
dhātusutta 5

nt. Itivuttaka 51 (ITI 51) ✗
dhātuso 1

ind. as states; as elements; by way of the elements [√dhā + tu + so] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of dhātu
Meaning as states; as elements; by way of the elements
Root Family √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction √dhā + tu + so
dhātu + so
Derivative taddhita (so)
Commentary (SNa) dhātuso upaparikkhatī'ti, dhātusabhāvena passati oloketi.
Sanskrit dhātu
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ yathāṭhitaṃ yathāpaṇihitaṃ dhātuso paccavekkhati atthi imasmiṃ kāye pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū'ti

DN 22.6 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhātuso upaparikkhati, āyatanaso upaparikkhati, paṭiccasamuppādaso upaparikkhati. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tividh'ūpaparikkhī hoti.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

Root Family √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction √dhā + tu + so
dhātu + so

Commentary (ITIa) dhātuso'ti dhātuto. dhātū'ti ca ajjhāsayadhātu ajjhāsayasabhāvo adhippeto, yo adhimuttī'ti'pi vuccati.
Sanskrit dhātu
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 493
dhāna

nt. placing; putting [√dhā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, in comps, from dhāyati
Meaning placing; putting
Root Family √dhā
Root √dhā･1 ya (place, support)
Construction √dhā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym ādhāna
Sanskrit dhāna
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Examples

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, maraṇaṃ? yaṃ tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā tamhā sattanikāyā cuti cavanatā bhedo antaradhānaṃ maccu maraṇaṃ kālakiriyā khandhānaṃ bhedo kaḷevarassa nikkhepo jīvitindriyassupacchedo, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, maraṇaṃ

DN 22.15 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

evam'etesaṃ, bhikkhave, suttantānaṃ tathāgatabhāsitānaṃ gambhīrānaṃ gambhīr'atthānaṃ lok'uttarānaṃ suññatappaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ antaradhānaṃ bhavissati.

JA 488 bhisa jātakaṃ

kusāvatiyā, ānanda, rājadhāniyā catunnaṃ vaṇṇānaṃ dvārāni ahesuṃ. ekaṃ dvāraṃ sovaṇṇamayaṃ, ekaṃ rūpiyamayaṃ, ekaṃ veḷuriyamayaṃ, ekaṃ phalikamayaṃ.

Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

esā antaradhāyāmi,
kucchiṃ vā pavisāmi te,
pakhum'antarikāyam'pi,
tiṭṭhantiṃ maṃ na dakkhasi.

SN 5.5 uppalavaṇṇāsuttaṃ

VIN 2.7.6 surusuruvaggo

VIN 1.4.2.3 dvebhāgasikkhāpadaṃ
dhārā 1.1

Meaning stream of water; rain-shower; lit. carrying

Construction √dhar > dhār + *ā

Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (DNa) dhāran'ti vuṭṭhiṃ.
Notes PED suggests √dhāv
Sanskrit dhārā
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, yā ca loke savantiyo mahāsamuddaṃ appenti, yā ca antalikkhā dhārā papatanti, na tena mahāsamuddassa ūnattaṃ vā pūrattaṃ vā paññāyati

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

tato pāsādikaṃ āsi, gataṃ bhuttaṃ nisevitaṃ.
siniddhā teladhārā'va, ahosi iriyāpatho.

TH 257 pārāpariyattheragāthā
dhārā 2.1

fem. (of a weapon) sharp edge; blade [√dhāv + rā] ✓

Meaning (of a weapon) sharp edge; blade

Derivative kita (rā)
Sanskrit dhārā
Sanskrit Root √dhāv 1 (rinse)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, matajaṃ nāma āvudhajātaṃ ubhatodhāraṃ pītanisitaṃ. tadassa saṅghāṭiyā sampārutaṃ sampaliveṭhitaṃ. tath'ūpam'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, imassa bhikkhuno pabbajjaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ

moneyyaṃ te upaññissaṃ,
khuradhārā-upamo bhave,
jivhāya tālum'āhacca,
udare saññato siyā.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
dhārānipātabubbuḷaka

nt. bubbles from the falling stream [dhārā + nipāta + bubbuḷaka] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bubbles from the falling stream
Construction dhārā + nipāta + bubbuḷaka
dhārita

pp. remembered; retained in mind; known off by heart [√dhar + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of dhāreti
Meaning remembered; retained in mind; known off by heart
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･8 *e (wear, hold, carry)
Base √dhar + *e > dhāre
Construction dhāre + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym adhārita
Synonym dhata, dhāta
Sanskrit dhṛta
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Example

anuddiṭṭhaṃ idaṃ varaṃ, anuggahitaṃ idaṃ varaṃ, apariyāpuṭaṃ idaṃ varaṃ, adhāritaṃ idaṃ varaṃ, vinayo vā antaradhāyatu, ime vā bhikkhū apakataññuno hontū'ti upasampannassa vinayaṃ vivaṇṇeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.8.2 vilekhanasikkhāpadaṃ

dhārī 1.1

Examples

n'āhaṃ alaṃ tuyha vase nivattituṃ,
mah'esino pabbajito'mhi sāsane,
na mādisā honti vināsadhārino.

Examples

adhisīlaṃ adhicittaṃ,
adhipaññañ'ca vīriyavā,

Meaning resolute; determined; persistent; lit. full of resolution

Synonym dhitimant, pahitatta
dhiratthu

sandhi. (+acc) shame on you!; damn you!; curse you!; to hell with! [dhi + atthu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + imp (+acc)
Meaning shame on you!; damn you!; curse you!; to hell with!
Construction dhi + [r] + atthu
Phonetic Change +r
Sanskrit dhik + astu

Examples

dhitipparaṃ kiṃ mama citta kāhisi,
na te alaṃ citta vas'ānuvattako,
na jātu bhastaṃ ubhatomukhaṃ chupe,
dhi'r'atthu pūraṃ nava sotasandaniṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

tatra sudaṃ, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro antepuraṃ gato dukkhī dummano pajjhāyati, dhi'r'atthu kira, bho, jāti nāma, yatra hi nāma jātassa jarā paññāyissatī'ti!

DN 14.5 mahāpadānasuttaṃ
dhī

ind. (+acc) shame on you!; woe on him!; damn you! ✓

Grammar ind, excl (+acc)
Meaning shame on you!; woe on him!; damn you!
Variant dhi
Sanskrit dhik

Examples

na brāhmaṇassa pahareyya,
n'āssa muñcetha brāhmaṇo,
dhī brāhmaṇassa hantāraṃ,
tato dhī yassa muñcati.

DHP 389 brāhmaṇavaggo

dhī taṃ jammi jare atthu,
dubbaṇṇakaraṇī jare,
tāva manoramaṃ bimbaṃ,
jarāya abhimadditaṃ.

SN 48.41 jarādhammasuttaṃ
dhītar

fem. daughter ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning daughter
Antonym putta
Synonym sutā
Sanskrit duhitṛ

Examples

yattakaṃ tulitā esā,
tuyhaṃ dhītā anopamā,
tato aṭṭhaguṇaṃ dassaṃ,
hiraññaṃ ratanāni ca.

THI 54 anopamātherīgāthā

atha kho kokanadā pajjunnassa dhītā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ mahāvanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi.

Example

sobhasī suvasanehi n'ūpame.

dhīyati

pr. is placed; is supported [√dhā + īya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of dahati, intrans
Meaning is placed; is supported
Root Family √dhā
Root √dhā･1 īya (place, support)

Example

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 502
dhīyamāna

prp. bearing [√dhā] ✗
dhīyi

aor. was borne [√dhā] ✗
dhīra 1.1

adj. stable; constant; reliable; firm [√dhā + ra] ✓

Grammar adj, from dhīyati
Meaning stable; constant; reliable; firm
Root Family √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction √dhā > dhī + ra
Derivative kita (ra)
Phonetic Change ā > ī (Kacc 502, 493)
Synonym avaṭṭhita, thira, thera, nikkama, nicca, nibaddha
Commentary (KPa) dhīrā'ti dhitisampannā.
Sanskrit dhīra
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Examples

no ce labhetha nipakaṃ sahāyaṃ,
saddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāridhīraṃ,
rājā'va raṭṭhaṃ vijitaṃ pahāya,
eko care mātaṅg'araññ'eva nāgo.

DHP 329 nāgavaggo

ye ca kho te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū nikkuhā nillapā dhīrā atthaddhā susamāhitā, te kho me, bhikkhave, bhikkhū māmakā. anapagatā ca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmā dhammavinayā. te ca imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ viruḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjantī'ti.

AN 4.26 kuhasuttaṃ
dhīra 2.1

adj. wise; intelligent [√dhī + ra] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning wise; intelligent
Root Family √dhī
Root √dhī×1 a (think)
Construction √dhī + ra
Derivative kita (ra)
Antonym bāla, adhīra
Synonym ñāṇī, nipaka, pañña, paññava, paññavant, paññāṇavant, paññāvant, paṇḍita, matimant, matīmant, mutimant, mutīmant, viññū, sapañña, sappañña
Sanskrit dhīra
Sanskrit Root √dhī 2, 3 (think)

Examples

diṭṭhe dhamme ca yo attho,
yo cattho samparāyiko,
atth'ābhisamayā dhīro,
paṇḍito'ti pavuccatī'ti.

SN 3.17 attabyābādhasuttaṃ

pañcannaṃ dhīro bhayānaṃ na bhāye,
bhikkhu sato sapariyantacārī,
ḍaṃs'ādhipātānaṃ sarīsapānaṃ,
manussaphassānaṃ catuppadānaṃ.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
dhīra 2.2

masc. wise man; sage; intelligent person [√dhī + ra] ✓

Meaning wise man; sage; intelligent person

Construction √dhī + ra

Antonym bāla
Synonym paṇḍita, viññū, sumedha
Sanskrit dhīra
Sanskrit Root √dhī 2, 3 (think)

Examples

paññāpāsādam'āruyha,
asoko sokiniṃ pajaṃ,
pabbataṭṭho'va bhūmaṭṭhe,
dhīro bāle avekkhati.

ubhosu antesu vineyya chandaṃ,
phassaṃ pariññāya anānugiddho,
yadattagarahī tadakubbamāno,
na lippatī diṭṭhasutesu dhīro.

dhuta 1

nt. ascetic practice; lit. shaken off; removed [√dhū + ta] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of dhunāti
Meaning ascetic practice; lit. shaken off; removed
Root Family √dhū
Root √dhū･5 nā (shake, smoke)
Construction √dhū + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Synonym tapacaraṇa, dhutaguṇa, dhutaṅga
Variant dhūta
Commentary (THa) sadā dhute rato'ti sabbakālañ'ca dhutaguṇe abhirato.
Sanskrit dhuta
Sanskrit Root √dhū 2, 5, 6, 9 (shake)

Examples

āraññiko hohi ca piṇḍapātiko,
sosāniko hohi ca paṃsukūliko,
nesajjiko hohi sadā dhute rato,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

aṭṭha dhut'aṅgāni, āraññik'aṅgaṃ, piṇḍapātik'aṅgaṃ, paṃsukūlik'aṅgaṃ, tecīvarik'aṅgaṃ, sapadānacārik'aṅgaṃ, khalupacchābhattik'aṅgaṃ, nesajjik'aṅgaṃ, yathāsanthatik'aṅgaṃ, idaṃ vuccati vataṃ, na sīlaṃ.

na māra bhāyāmi tam'ekikā'pi.

dhuttapaccatthika

Meaning enemy gangster; hostile rogue

dhuttapurisa

masc. womanizer; sexually promiscuous man ✗
dhuttikā

fem. who leads a corrupted life, scoundrel, cheat [√dhur] ✗

fem. who leads a corrupted life, scoundrel, cheat [√dhur] ✗
dhunana

nt. shaking off, doing away with [√dhū] ✗
dhunanta

prp. tossing, shaking off, removing [√dhū] ✗
dhunamāna

prp. (+acc) shaking off [√dhū + nā + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of dhunāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning shaking off
Root Family √dhū
Root √dhū･5 nā (shake, smoke)
Base √dhū + nā > dhunā
Construction dhunā + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Commentary (UDa) dhunamānassa pure kataṃ rajan'ti arahattappattito pubbe kataṃ rāgaraj'ādimissatāya rajan'ti laddhanāmaṃ dukkhavedanīyaṃ kammaṃ vipākapaṭisaṃvedanena taṃ dhunantassa viddhaṃsentassa, arahattappattiyā parato pana sāvajjakiriyāya sambhavo'y'eva n'atthi, anavajjakiriyā ca bhavamūlassa samucchinnattā samucchinnamūlatāya pupphaṃ viya phaladānasamatthatāya abhāvato kiriyamattā'va hoti.
Sanskrit dhūyamāna
Sanskrit Root √dhū 2, 5, 6, 9 (shake)

Example

sabbakammajahassa bhikkhuno,
dhunamānassa pure kataṃ rajaṃ,
amamassa ṭhitassa tādino,
attho n'atthi janaṃ lapetave'ti.

yuñjatha buddhasāsane,

naḷ'āgāraṃ'va kuñjaro.
