TH 206 vijitasenattheragāthā
dhura 4

nt. responsibility; duty; burden; lit. yoke-pole [√dhar + a] ✓

Grammar nt, from dharati
Meaning responsibility; duty; burden; lit. yoke-pole
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar > dhur + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change a > u (sk ṛ)
Synonym vatta
Commentary (VINa) dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte'ti dhure nikkhittamatte. sace'pi dhuraṃ nikkhipitvā pacchā āroceti, na rakkhati, dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte'y'eva pācittiyan'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit dhura
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)

Examples

idh'āvuso satthu pavivittassa viharato sāvakā vivekaṃ n'ānusikkhanti, yesañ'ca dhammānaṃ satthā pahānam'āha, te ca dhamme nappajahanti, bāhulikā ca honti, sāthalikā, okkamane pubbaṅ'gamā, paviveke nikkhittadhurā

MN 3 dhammadāyādasuttaṃ

paṭicchādeyyā'ti, imaṃ jānitvā codessanti, sāressanti khuṃsessanti, vambhessanti, maṅkuṃ karissanti n'ārocessāmī'ti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.7.4 duṭṭhullasikkhāpadaṃ
dhura 5

nt. weight; burden; load; lit. yoke-pole [√dhar + a] ~

Grammar nt, from dharati
Meaning weight; burden; load; lit. yoke-pole
Root Family √dhar
Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)
Construction √dhar > dhur + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change a > u (sk ṛ)
Sanskrit dhura
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)
dhuragāma

masc. neighbouring village ✗
dhurageha

nt. first house [dhura + geha] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning first house
Construction dhura + geha
dhuradhorayha

nt. team of oxen; lit. yoke bearer [dhura + dhorayha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning team of oxen; lit. yoke bearer
Construction dhura + dhorayha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhuraṃ + dhorayha)
Commentary (SNPa) dhuradhorayhan'ti dhurāyaṃ dhorayhaṃ dhuradhorayhaṃ, dhuraṃ vahatī'ti attho.
Sanskrit dhura + dhaureya

Example

vīriyaṃ me dhuradhorayhaṃ,
yogakkhem'ādhivāhanaṃ,
gacchati anivattantaṃ,
yattha gantvā na socati.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
dhuranikkhepa

masc. giving up of a hope or responsibility ✗
dhurandhara

adj. bearing the office or taking the responsibility ✗
dhurabhatta

nt. regularly given meal ✗

Root √dhar･1 a (hold, carry, endure)

dhura + vant

Phonetic Change a > u (sk ṛ)
Commentary (SNa) dhuravā'ti cetasikavīriyavasena anikkhittadhuro.
Sanskrit Root √dhṛ 1 (hold)
dhuravanta

adj. carrying one's burden, undertaking responsibility ✗
dhuravahana

nt. bearing of the yoke or office ✗

masc. nearby monastery [dhura + vihāra] ✓

Meaning nearby monastery
Construction dhura + vihāra
Compound kammadhāraya (dhura + vihāra)
Sanskrit dhura + vihāra

Example

rājā satthu vacanaṃ sutvā, aho, bhante, bhāriyaṃ kammaṃ, ettake nāma bhoge vijjamāne n'eva attanā paribhuñji, na tumhādise buddhe dhuravihāre viharante puññakammaṃ akāsī'ti āha.

DHPa 2.24.11 aputtakaseṭṭhi vatthu
dhurasamādhi

masc. proper alignment, evenness of the yoke ✗
dhurassaha

adj. bearing the pole or yoke ✗
dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte

idiom. in the fact of abandoning one's duty; in merely shirking responsibility ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + masc
Meaning in the fact of abandoning one's duty; in merely shirking responsibility
Commentary (VINa) dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte'ti dhure nikkhittamatte. sace'pi dhuraṃ nikkhipitvā pacchā āroceti, na rakkhati, dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte'y'eva pācittiyan'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit dhura + nikṣipta + mātra

Example

paṭicchādeyyā'ti, imaṃ jānitvā codessanti, sāressanti khuṃsessanti, vambhessanti, maṅkuṃ karissanti n'ārocessāmī'ti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.7.4 duṭṭhullasikkhāpadaṃ
dhuva 1

adj. stable; enduring; eternal; everlasting [√dhuv + a] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning stable; enduring; eternal; everlasting
Root Family √dhuv
Root √dhuv×1 a (be firm, solid)
√ In Comps ddhuv
Construction √dhuv + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym addhuva
Synonym sanantana, sassata
Commentary (MNa) dhuvo'ti thiro sārabhūto.
Sanskrit dhruva
Sanskrit Root √dhru √dhruv 6 (be firm or fixed)

Examples

atthi nu kho bhante kiñci rūpaṃ yaṃ rūpaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati

SN 22.97 nakhasikhāsuttaṃ

kiñ'ca, bhikkhave, n'atthisammataṃ loke paṇḍitānaṃ, yam'ahaṃ n'atthī'ti vadāmi? viññāṇaṃ niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhammaṃ n'atthisammataṃ loke paṇḍitānaṃ, aham'pi taṃ n'atthī'ti vadāmi.

SN 22.94 pupphasuttaṃ
dhuva 2

adj. continuous; constant; regular [√dhuv + a] ~

Meaning continuous; constant; regular

√ In Comps ddhuv
Construction √dhuv + a

Antonym addhuva

Sanskrit dhruva

addhuvaṃ me jīvitaṃ, dhuvaṃ me maraṇaṃ, avassaṃ mayā maritabbaṃ, maraṇapariyosānaṃ me jīvitaṃ, jīvitaṃ me aniyataṃ, maraṇaṃ me niyataṃ

ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā dhūtā sallekhavuttino samaṇo pana gotamo bāhulliko bāhullāya cetetīti.

VIN 1.2.10 saṅghabhedasikkhāpadaṃ

nt. flavouring, seasoning (of curry) [√dhūp] ✗

Commentary (ANa) na dhūpāyatī'ti ajjhattikassa upādāya taṇhāvicaritavasena na dhūpāyati.
Sanskrit dhūpāyati
Sanskrit Root √dhūp √dhūpaya 10 (fumigate)

Example

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu n'eva usseneti na paṭiseneti na dhūpāyati na pajjalati na sampajjhāyati.

AN 4.200 pemasuttaṃ
dhūpāyanta

prp. emitting smoke, fumigating [√dhūp] ✗

aor. emitted smoke, fumigated [√dhūp] ✗

Sanskrit dhūpāyita
Sanskrit Root √dhūp √dhūpaya 10 (fumigate)

Examples

kenassu'bbhāhato loko,
kenassu parivārito,
kena sallena otiṇṇo,
kissa dhūpāyito sadā'ti.

SN 1.66 attahatasuttaṃ

maccun'ābbhāhato loko,
jarāya parivārito.
taṇhāsallena otiṇṇo,
icchādhūpāyito sadā'ti.

SN 1.66 attahatasuttaṃ
dhūpāyitvā

abs. having emitted smoke [√dhūp] ✗

aor. flavoured or seasoned with oil, fumigated [√dhūp] ✗
dhūma

masc. smoke [√dhū + ma] ✓

Grammar masc, from dhunāti
Meaning smoke
Root Family √dhū
Root √dhū･5 nā (shake, smoke)
Construction √dhū + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Variant dhuma
Commentary (SNa) aggi'pi dūrato'va dhūmena paññāyati. (SDM) dhūmo'ti dhunāti kampatī'ti dhūmo.
Sanskrit dhūma
Sanskrit Root √dhū 2, 5, 6, 9 (shake)

Examples

māno hi te brāhmaṇa khāribhāro,
kodho dhūmo bhasmani mosavajjaṃ,
jivhā sujā hadayaṃ jotiṭhānaṃ,
attā sudanto purisassa joti.

SN 7.9 sundarikasuttaṃ

dhajo rathassa paññāṇaṃ,
dhūmo paññāṇam'aggino,
rājā raṭṭhassa paññāṇaṃ,
bhattā paññāṇam'itthiyā'ti.

SN 1.72 rathasuttaṃ
dhūmakārijātaka

nt. Jātaka 413 (JA 413) ✗

ind. until death or cremation (or adjective, lasting until cremation (?) ✗

masc. comet, fire ✗

masc. smoky fire (?); flames enveloped in smoke (?) ✗
dhūmajāla

nt. mass of smoke ✗
dhūmanetta

nt. outlet for smoke, tobacco pipe ✗
dhūmasikha

masc. fire ✗
dhūmāyati 1

pr. smokes; smoulders; fumes [√dhū + āya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, deno of dhūma, intrans
Meaning smokes; smoulders; fumes
Root Family √dhū
Root √dhū･5 āya (shake, smoke)
Base √dhū + ma + āya > dhūmāya (deno)
Construction dhūmāya + ti
Synonym dhūpāyati, dhūmeti, sandhūpeti, sandhūmāyati, saṃdhūmāyati
Sanskrit dhūmayati
Sanskrit Root √dhū 2, 5, 6, 9 (shake)

Example

bhikkhu bhikkhu, ayaṃ vammiko rattiṃ dhūmāyati, divā pajjalati. brāhmaṇo evam'āha, abhikkhaṇa, sumedha, satthaṃ ādāyā'ti. abhikkhaṇanto sumedho satthaṃ ādāya addasa laṅgiṃ. laṅgī, bhadante'ti.

MN 23 vammikasuttaṃ
dhūmāyati 2

pr. is hazy; is cloudy; is smoky; is misty; is fuzzy [√dhū + āya + ti] ✓

Meaning is hazy; is cloudy; is smoky; is misty; is fuzzy

Root √dhū･5 āya (shake, smoke)
Base √dhū + ma + āya > dhūmāya (deno)
Construction dhūmāya + ti
Sanskrit dhūmayati
Sanskrit Root √dhū 2, 5, 6, 9 (shake)

Example

so gehā nikkhamitvā … akkhīni me dhūmāyantī'ti vatvā nalāṭe hatthaṃ ṭhapetvā uddhaṃ oloketvā, aho dukkhaṃ, ayyo no mahākassapatthero cirassaṃ me kuṭidvāraṃ āgato, atthi nu kho kiñci gehe'ti āha

DHPa 1.4.10 mahākassapatthera piṇḍapātadinna vatthu
dhūmāyanā

fem. smoking; smouldering; fuming [√dhū + āya + anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from dhūmāyati, deno
Meaning smoking; smouldering; fuming
Root Family √dhū
Root √dhū･5 āya (shake, smoke)
Base √dhū + ma + āya > dhūmāya (deno)
Construction dhūmāya + anā
Derivative kita (anā)
Sanskrit dhūmāyana
Sanskrit Root √dhū 2, 5, 6, 9 (shake)

Examples

ko nu kho, bhante, vammiko, kā rattiṃ dhūmāyanā, kā divā pajjalanā, ko brāhmaṇo, ko sumedho, kiṃ satthaṃ, kiṃ abhikkhaṇaṃ, kā laṅgī, kā uddhumāyikā, ko dvidhāpatho, kiṃ caṅgavāraṃ, ko kummo, kā asisūnā, kā maṃsapesi, ko nāgo'ti?

MN 23 vammikasuttaṃ

yaṃ kho, bhikkhu, divā kammante ārabbha rattiṃ anuvitakketi anuvicāreti, ayaṃ rattiṃ dhūmāyanā. yaṃ kho, bhikkhu, rattiṃ anuvitakketvā anuvicāretvā divā kammante payojeti kāyena vācāya manasā, ayaṃ divā pajjalanā.

MN 23 vammikasuttaṃ
dhūmāyi

aor. smoked, smouldered, clouded over [√dhū] ✗
dhūmāyita

pp. obscured, darkened (as if by smoke); hot, suffering [√dhū] ✗
dhūmāyitatta

nt. cloud of smoke [√dhū + āya + ita + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from dhūmāyita, deno
Meaning cloud of smoke
Root Family √dhū
Root √dhū･5 āya (shake, smoke)
Base √dhū + ma + āya > dhūmāya (deno)
Construction dhūmāya + ita + tta
dhūmāyita + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Commentary (SNa) dhūmāyitattan'ti dhūmāyanabhāvaṃ. timirāyitattan'ti timirāyanabhāvaṃ. dhūmavalāhakaṃ viya timiravalāhakaṃ viya cā'ti attho.
Sanskrit dhūmavattva
Sanskrit Root √dhū 2, 5, 6, 9 (shake)

Example

tena kho pana samayena dhūmāyitattaṃ timirāyitattaṃ gacchat'eva purimaṃ disaṃ, gacchati pacchimaṃ disaṃ, gacchati uttaraṃ disaṃ, gacchati dakkhiṇaṃ disaṃ, gacchati uddhaṃ, gacchati adho, gacchati anudisaṃ

Example

dummaṅkuyaṃ padasseti,

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
dhūmeti

pr. smokes; smoulders; fumes [√dhū + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, deno of dhūma, intrans
Meaning smokes; smoulders; fumes

Root √dhū･5 *e (shake, smoke)
Base √dhū + ma + e > dhūme (deno)
Construction dhūme + ti
Synonym dhūpāyati, dhūmāyati, sandhūpeti, sandhūmāyati, saṃdhūmāyati
Sanskrit dhūmayati
Sanskrit Root √dhū 2, 5, 6, 9 (shake)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kumbhakārapāko ālepito paṭhamaṃ dhūmeti saṃdhūmeti sampadhūmeti, evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, chaṭṭhassa sūriyassa pātubhāvā ayañ'ca mahāpathavī sineru ca pabbatarājā dhūmāyanti saṃdhūmāyanti sampadhūmāyanti.

AN 7.66 sattasūriyasuttaṃ
dhūli

dhenu 2

fem. milk [√dhe + nu] ✓

Meaning milk

Construction √dhe + nu
Derivative kita (nu)
Synonym khīra, payas
Commentary (NIDD1a) dhenupako'ti khīrapako.
Sanskrit dhenu
Sanskrit Root √dhe √dhā 1 (suck)

Example

so kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, ye te goṭṭhā paṭṭhitagāvo apagatagopālakā, tattha catukkuṇḍiko upasaṅkamitvā yāni tāni vacchakānaṃ taruṇakānaṃ dhenupakānaṃ gomayāni tāni sudaṃ āhāremi.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
dhenupa

masc. suckling calf; unweaned calf; (comm) (or) nursing cow; dairy cow; lit. drinking milk [dhenu + pa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning suckling calf; unweaned calf; (comm) (or) nursing cow; dairy cow; lit. drinking milk
Construction dhenu + pa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhenuṃ + pa)
Commentary (SNPa) dhenupā'ti dhenuṃ pivantā taruṇavacchakā, khīradāyikā vā gāvo.
Sanskrit dhenu + pa

Example

atthi vasā atthi dhenupā,
godharaṇiyo paveṇiyo'pi atthi,
usabho'pi gavampat'īdha atthi,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

SNP 2 dhaniyasuttaṃ
dhenupaka

adj. suckling; nursing; lit. drinking milk [dhenu + paka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning suckling; nursing; lit. drinking milk
Construction dhenu + paka
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (dhenuṃ + paka)
Synonym khīrapaka, khīrapāna, paka
Commentary (NIDD1a) dhenupako'ti khīrapako.
Sanskrit dhenu + pāka

Example

so kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, ye te goṭṭhā paṭṭhitagāvo apagatagopālakā, tattha catukkuṇḍiko upasaṅkamitvā yāni tāni vacchakānaṃ taruṇakānaṃ dhenupakānaṃ gomayāni tāni sudaṃ āhāremi.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
dhenusahassa

nt. one thousand milk cows ✗
dheyya 1

nt. (+gen) realm (of); sphere (of); power (of); influence (of); lit. to be put [√dhā + eyya] ✓

Grammar nt, in comps, ptp of dahati (+gen)
Meaning realm (of); sphere (of); power (of); influence (of); lit. to be put
Root Family √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction √dhā + eyya
Derivative kicca (eyya)
Synonym avacara, ādhipateyya, āyatana
Sanskrit dheya
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Examples

tasmā pajānaṃ na upādiyetha,
bhikkhu sato kiñcanaṃ sabbaloke,
ādānasatte iti pekkhamāno,
pajaṃ imaṃ maccudheyye visattan'ti.

SNP 67 bhadrāvudha māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 12

vārijo'va thale khitto,
okam'okata'ubbhato,
pariphandat'idaṃ cittaṃ,
māradheyyaṃ pahātave.

DHP 34 cittavaggo
dheyya 2

adj. putting on; assigning; imparting; lit. to be put [√dhā + eyya] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, ptp of dahati
Meaning putting on; assigning; imparting; lit. to be put
Root Family √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction √dhā + eyya
Derivative kicca (eyya)
Sanskrit dheya
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Example

ajito'ti tassa brāhmaṇassa nāmaṃ saṅkhā samaññā paññatti vohāro nāmaṃ nāmakammaṃ nāmadheyyaṃ nirutti byañjanaṃ abhilāpo'ti, icc'āyasmā ajito.

NIDD2 2.1 ajita māṇava pucchā niddesa
dhota 1

pp. washed; cleaned; rinsed [√dhov + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of dhovati
Meaning washed; cleaned; rinsed
Root Family √dhov
Root √dhov･1 a (wash, rinse)
Construction √dhov + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change vt > t
Synonym dhovita, vikkhālita
Sanskrit dhauta
Sanskrit Root √dhāv 1 (rinse)

Examples

so na khulukhulukārakaṃ pattaṃ dhovati, na samparivattakaṃ pattaṃ dhovati, na pattaṃ bhūmiyaṃ nikkhipitvā hatthe dhovati, hatthesu dhotesu patto dhoto hoti, patte dhote hatthā dhotā honti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

dhovā'ti āṇāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. dhotāni nissaggiyāni honti. rajā'ti āṇāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. rattāni nissaggiyāni honti. vijaṭehī'ti āṇāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. vijaṭitāni nissaggiyāni honti.

VIN 1.4.2.7 eḷakalomadhovāpanasikkhāpadaṃ
dhota 2

pp. (of a sword) polished; sharpened [√dhov + ta] ~

Grammar pp of dhovati
Meaning (of a sword) polished; sharpened
Root Family √dhov
Root √dhov･1 a (wash, rinse)
Construction √dhov + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change vt > t
Commentary (VINa) sakkharā vuccati kāḷasilā, tattha dhoto asi sakkharadhoto nāmā'ti vuccati, sakkharadhoto pāṇimhi assā'ti sakkharadhotapāṇi, pāsāṇe dhotanisitakhaggahattho'ti attho.
Sanskrit dhauta
Sanskrit Root √dhāv 1 (rinse)
dhotakamāṇavapucchā

fem. Sutta Nipāta 5.6 (SNP 60) ✗
dhotapaccatthara

nt. rug (for when one has) washed feet (?) ✗
dhotapādaka 1

adj. with washed feet; requiring clean feet ✗
dhotapādaka 2

nt. something to step on after washing one's feet ✗
dhotasaṅkhasappaṭibhāga

adj. resembling a polished conch shell [dhota + saṅkha + sappaṭibhāga] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning resembling a polished conch shell
Construction dhota + saṅkha + sappaṭibhāga
dhona 1

masc. pure one; purified being; lit. washed [√dhov + na] ✓

Grammar masc, pp of dhovati
Meaning pure one; purified being; lit. washed
Root Family √dhov
Root √dhov･1 a (wash, rinse)
Construction √dhov + na
Derivative kita (na)
Commentary (SNPa) dhonadhammasamannāgamā dhonassa dhutasabbapāpassa arahato
Sanskrit dhauta
Sanskrit Root √dhāv 1 (rinse)

Examples

atha tvaṃ pavitakkam'āgamā,
manasā diṭṭhigatāni cintayanto,
dhonena yugaṃ samāgamā,
na hi tvaṃ sakkhasi sampayātave'ti.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

dhonassa hi n'atthi kuhiñci loke,
pakappitā diṭṭhi bhav'ābhavesu,
māyañ'ca mānañ'ca pahāya dhono,
sa kena gaccheyya anūpayo so.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3
dhona 2

masc. (comm) term referring to the four requisites [√dhov + na] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning (comm) term referring to the four requisites
Root Family √dhov
Root √dhov･1 a (wash, rinse)
Construction √dhov + na
Derivative kita (na)
Commentary (DHPa) dhonā vuccati cattāro paccaye, idam'atthaṃ ete'ti paccavekkhitvā paribhuñjanapaññā, taṃ atikkamitvā caranto atidhonacārī nāma
Sanskrit dhauta
Sanskrit Root √dhāv 1 (rinse)

Example

ayasā'va malaṃ samuṭṭhitaṃ,
tat'uṭṭhāya tam'eva khādati,
evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ,
sakakammāni nayanti duggatiṃ.

DHP 240 malavaggo
dhona 3

adj. wise [√dhov] ✗
dhoraka

adj. (of cloth) rough [√dhur] ✗
dhorayha 1

adj. able to bear the burden [dhura + vaha + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning able to bear the burden
Construction dhura > dhora + vaha + *a
dhuravaha + *a > dhorayha
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (APt) dhuraṃ vahitum'arahatī'ti dhorayho
Notes (PED) *dhor + vayha = sk *dhaurvahya
Sanskrit dhaureya

Example

tasmā hi
dhīrañ'ca paññañ'ca bahussutañ'ca,
dhorayhasīlaṃ vatavantam'ariyaṃ,
taṃ t'ādisaṃ sappurisaṃ sumedhaṃ,
bhajetha nakkhattapathaṃ'va candimā.

DHP 208 sukhavaggo
dhorayha 2

masc. beast of burden; ox; draught-horse; lit. yoke carrying [dhura + vaha + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning beast of burden; ox; draught-horse; lit. yoke carrying
Construction dhura > dhora + vaha + *a
dhuravaha + *a > dhorayha
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Variant dhoreyya
Commentary (SNa) dhuravāh'aṭṭhena dhorayho.
Notes (PED) *dhor + vayha = sk *dhaurvahya
Sanskrit dhaureya

Examples

vīriyaṃ me dhuradhorayhaṃ,
yogakkhem'ādhivāhanaṃ,
gacchati anivattantaṃ,
yattha gantvā na socati.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4

dhorayho vata, bho, samaṇo gotamo, dhorayhavatā ca samuppannā sārīrikā vedanā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā asātā amanāpā sato sampajāno adhivāseti avihaññamāno'ti.

SN 1.38 sakalikasuttaṃ
dhorayhavatā

fem. being (like) who is fit to bear a burden (?) ✗
dhorayhavant

masc. who has ox-like qualities; who has a beast of burden-like character; lit. having yoke carrying quality [dhura + vaha + *a + vant] ✓

Grammar masc, from dhorayha, comp
Meaning who has ox-like qualities; who has a beast of burden-like character; lit. having yoke carrying quality
Construction dhura > dhora + vaha + *a + vant
dhorayha + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit dhaureya + vat

Example

dhorayho vata, bho, samaṇo gotamo, dhorayhavatā ca samuppannā sārīrikā vedanā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā asātā amanāpā sato sampajāno adhivāseti avihaññamāno'ti.

SN 1.38 sakalikasuttaṃ
dhorayhasīla

adj. virtuous; enduring; patient; lit. yoke carrying nature [dhorayha + sīla] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning virtuous; enduring; patient; lit. yoke carrying nature
Construction dhorayha + sīla
Compound kammadhāraya (dhorayha + sīla)
Synonym adhivāsaka, khama
Commentary (DHPa) dhuravahanasīlatāya dhorayhasīlaṃ
Sanskrit dhaureya + śīla

Example

tasmā hi
dhīrañ'ca paññañ'ca bahussutañ'ca,
dhorayhasīlaṃ vatavantam'ariyaṃ,
taṃ t'ādisaṃ sappurisaṃ sumedhaṃ,
bhajetha nakkhattapathaṃ'va candimā.

DHP 208 sukhavaggo
dhovaka

masc. washer; cleaner; rinser [√dhov + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from dhovati
Meaning washer; cleaner; rinser
Root Family √dhov
Root √dhov･1 a (wash, rinse)
Construction √dhov + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Sanskrit dhāvaka
Sanskrit Root √dhāv 1 (rinse)

Example

santi, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa oḷārikā upakkilesā paṃsuvālukā sakkharakaṭhalā. tam'enaṃ paṃsudhovako vā paṃsudhovak'antevāsī vā doṇiyaṃ ākiritvā dhovati sandhovati niddhovati.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
dhovati

pr. (+acc) washes; cleans; rinses [√dhov + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning washes; cleans; rinses
Root Family √dhov
Root √dhov･1 a (wash, rinse)
Base √dhov + a > dhova
Construction dhova + ti
Synonym opilāpeti, pakkhāleti, sandhovati
Commentary (ANa) dhovatī'ti vikkhāleti.
Sanskrit dhāvati
Sanskrit Root √dhāv 1 (rinse)

Examples

santi, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa oḷārikā upakkilesā paṃsuvālukā sakkharakaṭhalā. tam'enaṃ paṃsudhovako vā paṃsudhovak'antevāsī vā doṇiyaṃ ākiritvā dhovati sandhovati niddhovati.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ

kālena kālañ'ca vaṇaṃ dhoveyyāsi, kālena kālaṃ vaṇamukhaṃ ālimpeyyāsi, mā te na kālena kālaṃ vaṇaṃ dhovato na kālena kālaṃ vaṇamukhaṃ ālimpato pubbalohitaṃ vaṇamukhaṃ pariyonandhi.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
dhovana 1

nt. washing; cleaning; rinsing [√dhov + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from dhovati
Meaning washing; cleaning; rinsing
Root Family √dhov
Root √dhov･1 a (wash, rinse)
Construction √dhov + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym ācamana, vikkhālana
Sanskrit dhāvana, dhovana (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √dhāv 1 (rinse)

Examples

tasmā hi ne namasseyya,
sakkareyya ca paṇḍito,
annena atha pānena,
vatthena sayanena ca,
ucchādanena nhāpanena,
pādānaṃ dhovanena ca.

AN 4.63 brahmasuttaṃ

atthi, bhikkhave, dakkhiṇesu janapadesu dhovanaṃ nāma. tattha hoti annam'pi pānam'pi khajjam'pi bhojjam'pi leyyam'pi peyyam'pi naccam'pi gītam'pi vāditam'pi. atth'etaṃ, bhikkhave, dhovanaṃ, n'etaṃ n'atthī'ti vadāmi.

dhovanasutta

dhovanā

fem. (an instrument) for washing [√dhov] ✗

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

Meaning makes wash; causes to wash

Construction dhovāpe + ti

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpeyya vā rajāpeyya vā ākoṭāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 4 purāṇacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā eḷakalomāni dhovāpeyya vā rajāpeyya vā vijaṭāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 17 eḷakalomadhovāpanasikkhāpadaṃ
dhovi

VIN 4.1.15 upajjhāya vatta kathā

ger. (+acc) washing, rinsing, cleansing [√dhov] ✗

dhoveti

pr. (+acc) rubs; scrubs; grinds [√dhov + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of dhovati, trans (+acc)
Meaning rubs; scrubs; grinds
Root Family √dhov
Root √dhov･1 *e (wash, rinse)
Base √dhov + e > dhove (caus)
Construction dhove + ti
Synonym ghaṃseti
Variant dhopeti
Commentary (ANa) dhoveyyā'ti ghaṃseyya.
Sanskrit dhavayati
Sanskrit Root √dhāv 1 (rinse)

Example

sākhāpalāsaṃ suvisodhitaṃ visodhetvā kuṭhārīhi taccheyya, kuṭhārīhi tacchetvā vāsīhi taccheyya, vāsīhi tacchetvā lekhaṇiyā likheyya, lekhaṇiyā likhitvā pāsāṇaguḷena dhoveyya, pāsāṇaguḷena dhovetvā nadiṃ patāreyya.

dhovetvā

Base √dhov + e > dhove (caus)
Construction dhove + tvā
Synonym ghaṃsitvā

Sanskrit Root √dhāv 1 (rinse)

Example

sākhāpalāsaṃ suvisodhitaṃ visodhetvā kuṭhārīhi taccheyya, kuṭhārīhi tacchetvā vāsīhi taccheyya, vāsīhi tacchetvā lekhaṇiyā likheyya, lekhaṇiyā likhitvā pāsāṇaguḷena dhoveyya, pāsāṇaguḷena dhovetvā nadiṃ patāreyya.

dhūma + api
dhūmaṃ + api
dhūmanettanti

dhūmanettaṃ + iti
dhūmanettathavikanti

dhūmanetta + thavikaṃ + iti
dhūmanetta + atha + vikanti
dhūmanettañca

dhūmanettaṃ + ca
dhūmarajo

dhūma + rajo
dhūma + arajo
dhūmi + arajo
dhūmañca

dhūmaṃ + ca
dhūmāyatipi

dhūmāyati + api
dhūmīva

dhūmī + eva
dhūmi + iva
dhūpāyatipi

dhūpāyati + api
